## About the Role

Awe Inspired is seeking a highly detail-oriented Associate Web Merchant to
support product data, merchandising execution, and optimization of the onsite
experience.

## SITE WORK

  * Support and execute all product launches, ensuring complete accuracy in data, imagery, and site placement.

  * Own PLP remerchandising and ongoing category optimizations to improve product discovery and conversion.

  * Drive onsite merchandising, including Frequently Bought Together, Complete the Look, and other cross-merchandising strategies to increase AOV and expand basket size through cross selling and upsell merchandising. 

  * Establish and refine product data attributes to fuel site placements, filters, and sales recaps.

  * Collaborate with the site and digital teams to support storytelling, promotions, and seasonal initiatives.

  * Execute retail updates and assist with maintenance of collections, categories, and navigation flows.

  * Beyond the Awe site, this role will support merchandising and vendor management as we expand into additional online and wholesale channels

  * Manage the image catalog, including organizing assets, ensuring naming accuracy, and performing light Photoshop work on product composites when needed.

## MERCHANDISING WORK

  * Support creation of new product lists for site initiatives, wholesale partners, and brand events.

  * Assist in basic merchandising logicâ€”identifying strong product pairings and cohesive storytelling opportunities.

  * Learn to create and edit BOMs in Cin7 and maintain accurate product component data.

  * Support the product development process through tagging, early data setup, and organization of product attributes.

  * Execute and QA product data across Cin7, PDM, Shopify, and internal systems.

## GENERAL EXPECTATIONS

  * Own assigned tasks end-to-end with reliable follow-through, attention to detail, and clear communication.

  * Maintain exceptional accuracy across all product information, attributes, and site merchandising elements.

  * Ask questions early, seek clarification, and show eagerness to learn new tools, processes, and merchandising skills.

  * Collaborate effectively with cross-functional partners, including merchandising, creative, digital, and operations.

  * Bring a proactive mindset and readiness to take on additional responsibility as skills grow.

## **QUALIFICATIONS** :

  * Experience: Minimum of 2 years of professional experience in an e-commerce role.

  * Education: Bachelor's degree required in a relevant field such as Business, Marketing, Merchandising, or Product Development.

  * Ability to work in Cin7 and PDM, or strong willingness to learn quickly.

  * Familiarity with retail math and Excel. 

## GROWTH PATH

  * Begin by developing mastery of product data accuracy, merchandising basics, and site execution.

  * Learn retail math, core e-commerce processes, and how systems interconnect across the business.

  * Grow into owning a smaller category (e.g., Ritual) end-to-endâ€”data setup, merchandising, storytelling, and performance insights.

  * Progress to managing additional categories (e.g., Bracelets) with full-cycle responsibility as experience deepens.

## ROLE DETAILS

  * Full-time

  * Remote (international candidates welcome)

  * Reports to: Merchandise Manager

  * Strong opportunity for growth within merchandising and e-commerce

**The Opportunity**

This is an opportunity to shape the growth of a search firm redefining what
excellence looks like in deep-tech recruitment. Youâ€™ll drive client
acquisition and build partnerships that power tomorrowâ€™s technologies â€”
semiconductors, photonics, lasers, robotics, and advanced electronics. Youâ€™ll
work directly with Chris Thiel, Co-Founder and Head of Business Development,
to expand Insightâ€™s reach and reputation across Europe, Asia and North
America. We donâ€™t chase volume; we build trust, momentum, and meaningful
relationships that last. At Insight, weâ€™re not interested in clock-watching â€”
we care about outcomes. Youâ€™ll have the freedom to own your market,
experiment, and make visible impact in a firm where results, relationships,
and integrity come first.

**Your Impact**

In your first 12â€“18 months, you will:

-Define and execute a growth plan that expands Insightâ€™s footprint in high-value deep-tech markets.

\- Build a qualified pipeline of new clients and convert leads into retained
search partnerships.

\- Represent Insight at key industry events, developing lasting relationships
with founders and leaders.

\- Collaborate with marketing to co-create outreach campaigns and thought-
leadership initiatives. - Establish Insightâ€™s voice on LinkedIn through
content, engagement, and authentic conversation.

\- Use automation and AI tools to enhance, not replace, human connection â€”
ensuring efficiency with empathy. Youâ€™ll be trusted to experiment, refine, and
deliver â€” your success will directly shape how Insight grows.

**About You**

Youâ€™re a connector and a closer â€” disciplined, focused, and commercially
sharp. Structure and routine help you thrive, and you use them to stay
persistent, organized, and effective. You spot opportunities others miss,
follow through reliably, and make smart adjustments when needed.

Youâ€™re an exceptional communicator who thinks on your feet, expresses ideas
clearly, and genuinely enjoys conversations, presenting, and building
meaningful relationships. Your energy is positive and contagious â€” you
naturally get others excited about what youâ€™re working on.

Trust matters to you. You enjoy working hard with others to reach shared
goals, and your ability to form deep, authentic connections turns every
conversation into momentum.

Youâ€™ll thrive here if you:

-Love building networks and transforming conversations into strong partnerships.

-Lean into routine, structure, and focus to stay consistent and results-driven.

-Combine commercial drive with emotional intelligence and confident communication.

-Are digitally fluent and comfortable using LinkedIn for social selling and visibility.

-Embrace AI and automation to streamline outreach while keeping relationships at the centre.

-Work autonomously, taking direction well while proactively finding creative ways to open doors. -Believe in quality over quantity â€” youâ€™d rather build five deep partnerships than fifty surface-level ones.

-Bring enthusiasm and positivity that elevates the people around you.

**Your Background**

\- 3+ years in business development, client acquisition, or consultative sales
(executive search, professional services, or B2B preferred).

\- Proven track record managing the full sales cycle â€” from outreach to close.

\- Confident communicator (written, spoken, and digital) who engages senior
stakeholders naturally.

\- Skilled in content-driven outreach and engagement â€” especially on LinkedIn.

\- Experienced with cold outreach across multiple channels: phone, email, and
social. - Strong organization and ownership in a remote, asynchronous
environment.

\- Fluent in English; proficiency in German or French is highly desirable
(other languages a plus). - Exposure to or curiosity about deep-tech
industries is a strong advantage.  
\- Familiarity with CRMs preferred.

**Key Outcomes**

\- Pipeline coverage of at least 3Ã— annual revenue target.

\- Conversion of new retained client partnerships within 3â€“6 months.

\- Tangible contribution to group revenue and client diversity.

\- Increased market visibility and measurable inbound activity from digital
engagement.

\- Active collaboration with marketing to generate sustained lead flow.

**Working at Insight Technology Search**

Weâ€™re a small, sharp, collaborative team with over 35 years of combined
experience and 99% of our work retained â€” proof that clients trust us with
their most important hires. We operate remotely by design, built on trust,
autonomy, and results. Our core values guide everything we do:

_Customers First_ â€“ anticipate needs, deliver quality, build trust.
Collaborative â€“ communicate openly and share generously.

_Growth-Oriented_ â€“ seek feedback, stay curious, improve continuously.

_Solutions-Focused_ â€“ bring proposals, not problems.

_Tenacious_ â€“ persist through challenges and own outcomes.

We invest in our people with tailored training, opportunities to travel, and
in-person team meetups across Europe. Youâ€™ll find genuine balance here â€”
freedom to work flexibly, support to grow, and the satisfaction of seeing your
impact.

**Compensation, Benefits & Perks**

-â‚¬50,000 base salary with uncapped commission. On-Target Earnings (OTE) of â‚¬100,000+ based on achieving performance targets.

\- Fully remote â€” complete home office setup provided

\- Flexible schedule â€” autonomy to design your day around outcomes, not hours

\- Generous paid time off

\- Professional development budget for courses and growth goals

\- Annual team meetups and client travel opportunities across Europe and the
US

\- A culture built on trust, collaboration, and real work-life balance

**Our Hiring Process**

We believe recruitment should be transparent and thoughtful â€” designed to help
you assess us as much as we assess you.

1\. Application Review â€“ Every application is reviewed for alignment with our
goals and values.

2\. Skills Challenge (role-dependent) â€“ A short, practical exercise reflecting
real work.

3\. Interviews (3 total) - Technical Interview â€“ Experience, pipeline
approach, and results. - Values & Culture â€“ Communication, curiosity, and team
fit. - Final Interview â€“ Alignment on expectations and growth goals.

4\. Assessments (if applicable) â€“ Kolbe and CliftonStrengths for understanding
how you work best.

5\. Reference Checks â€“ Validation from a former manager and peer.

6\. Offer & Onboarding â€“ A clear, supported 30-60-90 day ramp-up plan.

 _**We anticipate conducting interviews starting in mid-January 2026.**_

**How to Apply**

Instead of a traditional cover letter, please provide your CV/ Resume, your
LinkedIn profile and answers to the questions below.

1\. What most excites you about this role and our focus on the deep-tech
sector?

2\. Tell us about a time you built a client relationship from scratch â€” what
was your approach and what was the result?

  
You may complete our application here: <https://tally.so/r/rj5Wgo>

Not sure you meet every requirement? Apply anyway. We value potential,
mindset, and learning agility as much as experience.

**Credit Joy** helps people overcome credit challenges and take control of

### What Youâ€™ll Do

  * Handle **20â€“30 inbound calls per day** with qualified leads

  * Run structured sales conversations and close consistently

  * Average **3+ sales per day**

  * Follow proven scripts, processes, and CRM workflows

  * Work closely with your sales coach to hit weekly and monthly goals

* * *

### What Weâ€™re Looking For

  * Sales, call center, or commission-based experience

  * **Excellent spoken English** (clear, professional, confident)

  * Strong closing ability and comfort with phone-based sales

  * Reliable high-speed internet (cabled) and quiet workspace

  * Laptop or desktop computer (8GB RAM minimum) and headset with mic

  * Self-motivated, coachable, and consistent

Remote sales experience is a plus, but not required

* * *

### Compensation & Growth

  * **Base pay + uncapped commission (USD)**

  * Top performers earn **$3,000â€“$5,000+ USD/month**

  * 100% remote, work from anywhere

  * Ongoing sales training and one-on-one coaching

  * Clear path to advancement - we promote from within

* * *

**Description:  
**  

AE Virtual Class, member of Academia Europea Group, leader in language
teaching, with 56 years of experience and the largest teaching staff in the
Americas! We are looking for language enthusiasts who want to be part of our
great family! Experience is NOT a requirement! We teach you how to teach!

  

**Job Requirements:  
**  

Laptop (with webcam).

Stable internet connection (15 Mbps).

Attitude.

Dynamism.

Afternoon and/or evening shifts (Central America time zone).

Excellent Mandarin, German, Italian or French proficiency (C1-C2).  
  

**Main responsibilities of the position:  
**  

Motivate students.

Generate interest in cultures and languages.

Prepare reports.

Evaluations.

* * *

postTitle: PHP Laravel Developer Needed ROCKSTARS ONLY
jobTitle: PHP Laravel Developer Needed ROCKSTARS ONLY
descContent:
# If you are looking for a comfy gig that doesn't challenge you to think
differently and get creative...please do not apply for this role.

WE ARE LOOKING TO HAND SELECT A SKILLED DEVELOPER TO REPORT DIRECTLY TO OUR
CTO AND CEO!

Details around this role can be found below.

In order to be considered for this role, please include one of your favorite
jokes!!! That way we know you read through the entirety of this job posting!

# **About Agent Legend**

Agent Legend is a fast-growing SaaS company building advanced AI-driven
communication tools that help businesses connect with their customers in
smarter, more personal ways. Our platform powers automated conversations
across SMS, email, voice, and more â€” enabling small businesses to scale
without losing their personal touch.

Weâ€™re looking for a skilled PHP/Laravel Developer to join our team and help us
build scalable backend systems, API integrations, and real-time messaging
services.

**What Youâ€™ll Do**

  * Develop, maintain, and optimize our Laravel-based backend applications.
  * Work with queues (Beanstalkd, Redis, Supervisor) to manage large-scale workloads.
  * Build and integrate APIs (internal + 3rd-party like CRMs, messaging platforms, payment systems).
  * Write clean, efficient, and testable code following modern PHP best practices.
  * Collaborate with our AI and frontend teams to deliver new features.
  * Troubleshoot production issues and optimize for performance and scalability.  

**What Weâ€™re Looking For**

âœ… Strong experience with PHP 8+ and Laravel (5+ years preferred).

âœ… Experience with queues (Beanstalkd, Redis, Supervisor, Horizon).

âœ… Solid knowledge of MySQL (indexes, performance optimization, migrations).

âœ… Experience with RESTful APIs, webhooks, and integrations.

âœ… Familiarity with Vue.js or modern frontend frameworks (bonus).

âœ… Comfortable with Git, Docker, and Linux servers.

âœ… Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.

âœ… Self-starter who thrives in a remote, collaborative environment.

  

**Nice-to-Haves**

  * Experience with CRM integrations (HubSpot, Salesforce, etc.).
  * Background in AI/ML-driven applications.
  * Experience scaling high-concurrency systems.
  * Familiarity with telephony (Twilio, Plivo) or messaging APIs.

Submit your resume (& your joke) to careers@agentlegend.com if you are
genuinely excited to join our team!

Please mention the word **DEVOUT** when applying to show you read the job post
completely (#RMTE4LjEwMC45NS4xODE=). This is a feature to avoid fake spam
applicants. Companies can search these words to find applicants that read this
and instantly see they're human.  
  

## Salary and compensation

  
$50,000 â€” $70,000/year

postTitle: Business Operations Manager (Commercial Operations) at Metabase
jobTitle: Business Operations Manager (Commercial Operations) at Metabase
descContent:
Metabase is the easiest way for people to get insights from their data, from
tiny startups who get up and running quickly to major corporations with tens
of thousands of users. That's why people [love
us](https://www.metabase.com/love).

  

We bring data tools with the elegance and simplicity of consumer products to
the crufty world of enterprise business intelligence. We provide an
opinionated open source starting point for how companies should measure,
analyze and share their data, which is used by tens of thousands of companies.

  

Metabaseâ€™s BizOps & Finance team is a small, high-leverage group that builds
the systems keeping the company running smoothly behind the scenes. We cover a
wide range of areas â€” finance and accounting, sales operations, legal
operations, compliance, and account management â€” but we treat them all as
flavors of operations. Whatever the task, we take a systems-driven approach â€”
design it, build it, and run it (ideally, automatically). Our goal is to free
the rest of the company to focus on building great software.

  

Weâ€™re looking for a high-powered generalist with strong verbal and analytical
reasoning skills to own and run our **commercial operations**. In this role,
youâ€™ll be responsible for the systems and processes that underpin how we
contract with customers and manage commercial risk, helping us close deals
efficiently and serve a broader range of customers. Youâ€™ll manage contracting,
partner closely with internal teams and external counsel to make business
decisions on risk, and lead key compliance initiatives, translating complex
requirements into practical, scalable processes. This role is well-suited to
someone who is comfortable moving between big-picture thinking and detailed
execution, and who enjoys turning ambiguous problems into working systems that
reduce friction and help the business grow.

Metabaseâ€™s BizOps & Finance team is a small, high-leverage group that builds
the systems keeping the company running smoothly behind the scenes. We cover a
wide range of areas â€” finance and accounting, sales operations, legal
operations, compliance, and account management â€” but we treat them all as
flavors of operations. Whatever the task, we take a systems-driven approach â€”
design it, build it, and run it (ideally, automatically). Our goal is to free
the rest of the company to focus on building great software.

  

Weâ€™re looking for a high-powered generalist with strong verbal and analytical
reasoning skills to own and run our **commercial operations**. In this role,
youâ€™ll be responsible for the systems and processes that underpin how we
contract with customers and manage commercial risk, helping us close deals
efficiently and serve a broader range of customers. Youâ€™ll manage contracting,
partner closely with internal teams and external counsel to make business
decisions on risk, and lead key compliance initiatives, translating complex
requirements into practical, scalable processes. This role is well-suited to
someone who is comfortable moving between big-picture thinking and detailed
execution, and who enjoys turning ambiguous problems into working systems that
reduce friction and help the business grow.

### Responsibilities

* Partner with external counsel and our Sales team to identify and mitigate business risks during contract reviews
* Maintain and update contract templates, terms of service, privacy policies, and related documents
* Improve and maintain systems that support our commercial operations (e.g. routing contract reviews, implementing and building-out our contract management system)
* Drive compliance-enhancement projects to reduce risk and expand our ability to serve regulated and enterprise customers.
* Note that this is not a people-management role

### About you

* You come from either a generalist business background (e.g. consulting, operations) or a legal background and are excited to expand beyond a purely legal role into commercial and operational decision-making
* You are a structured, analytical thinker with strong verbal reasoning skills, comfortable working with complex written materials and ambiguous problems
* You are comfortable working with numbers and have the ability and interest to learn financial concepts
* You can reason through business processes end-to-end and have the aptitude to improve or automate them over time
* You collaborate effectively with internal stakeholders and external experts (e.g. lawyers, customers)
* You are organized, able to manage multiple projects in parallel, and reliably drive work to completion
* You have demonstrated sound judgment, ownership, and a bias for action in fast-paced environments
* You bring a low-ego attitude â€” no job is too small or too large
* Strong academic background with evidence of analytical rigor
* Nice-to-have: MBA

We're a global team (50% outside the US), fully distributed (from Thailand to
California), who get things done asynchronously, with plenty of uninterrupted
time, supporting each other to do the best work of our careers. We offer
flexibility (define your own schedule and work from wherever you want),
autonomy, and an environment that fosters growth, learning, and development.
We're relentlessly user-focused and believe in building long-term value, not
short-term hacks. And we raised a $30M Series B to take our approach to the
next level for years to come.

  

For U.S. applicants: Metabase participates in the federal E-Verify program,
which confirms employment authorization of newly hired U.S. based employees.
E-Verify is not used as a tool to pre-screen candidates and is only initiated
upon hire.

  

[E-Verify Participation
Notice](https://www.e-verify.gov/sites/default/files/everify/posters/EVerifyParticipationPoster.pdf)
(English/Spanish)

[Right to Work
Notice](https://www.e-verify.gov/sites/default/files/everify/posters/IER_RightToWorkPoster%20Eng_Es.pdf)
(English/Spanish)

Metabase is the easiest way for people to get insights from their data, from
tiny startups who get up and running quickly to major corporations with tens
of thousands of users. That's why people [love
us](https://www.metabase.com/love).

  

We bring data tools with the elegance and simplicity of consumer products to
the crufty world of enterprise business intelligence. We provide an
opinionated open source starting point for how companies should measure,
analyze and share their data, which is used by tens of thousands of companies.

postTitle: SENIOR HR ASSISTANT (100% Remote outside of Canada) at Wishpond
jobTitle: SENIOR HR ASSISTANT (100% Remote outside of Canada) at Wishpond
descContent:
**Wishpond Technologies currently has the position of Senior Human Resources
Assistant available, and weâ€™re excited to tell you about it !**

**Please note, this position is expected to work an 8-hour day shift (Pacific
time zone, GMT-8). The business language used in this position is English, so
please ensure your resume is in English, as well as your answers to any of the
questions we have included as part of the application process.**

**OVERVIEW**

We are excited to welcome a new Senior Human Resources Assistant to join us on
a full-time basis, in this 100% remote position. You will work with a small
but amazing remote team servicing and building relationships with 200+ global
Team Members. This is a supervisory role overseeing the HR Assistants while at
the same time equally contributing to a highly administrative department. The
successful applicant must be extremely confidential, given the nature of the
data and information collected within the department. In collaboration with
the HR Team and all departments, the Senior HR Assistant is responsible for
the success of Wishpond Technologies Ltd.

**RESPONSIBILITIES**

â€¢ Assist with and oversee the daily administration of the department,
including requests from both internal and external customers and stakeholders

â€¢ Oversee, mentor, and coach the HR Assistants (2-3 Team Members), ensuring
assignment of tasks, completion of tasks and their personal development

â€¢ Ensure alignment with overall goals while promoting cross-team collaboration
and continuous improvement.

â€¢ Create policies, procedures and processes, ensuring alignment with internal
and external requirements

â€¢ Oversee recruitment, onboarding and offboarding programs and processes

â€¢ Process Team Memberâ€™s requests and provide relevant information on the
resolution of concerns and a clear understanding of processes, while referring
special communications to the appropriate person

â€¢ Prepare reports and documentation for internal communications within the HR
department

â€¢ Verify employment background checks by contacting references (via email)

â€¢ General administration, including file maintenance, data entry, control and
verification, and preparation and distribution of reports

â€¢ Perform other leadership duties as required to support departmental
efficiency, employee development, and organizational success.

â€¢ Other duties as assigned.

**QUALIFICATIONS**

â€¢ 2-3 years of experience in administration, preferably within an HR-related
environment

â€¢ Experience with team leadership, training and task assignments

â€¢ Ability to handle sensitive and highly confidential information

â€¢ Solid data entry experience with a minimum of 50wpm typing

â€¢ Passionate about HR policies and procedures and wants to help create a
nourishing workplace

â€¢ PC literacy and experience with MS Office applications

â€¢ A degree or diploma that contributes to the organization or role is
considered an asset

â€¢ Must be very detail-oriented, creative, and have a passion for helping
others achieve their goals

â€¢ Self-motivated with the ability to establish and maintain solid
relationships through a client-first mentality

â€¢ As part of a diverse team, the ability to work both independently and
collaboratively in a fast-paced, results-oriented environment

â€¢ Must be technical and analytical, and have the ability to manage complex
projects seamlessly

â€¢ Organized, administratively strong, great time management, and have solid
writing, phone, and general communication skills

â€¢ Fluent in English (spoken and written). Knowledge of a second language is
considered an asset

**WORK ENVIRONMENT**

â€¢ This is a 100% remote position, and the individual could be based anywhere
outside of Canada

â€¢ Given the nature of this role, it is expected that the successful candidate
will provide their own workstation, computer, and headset and have a fast and
reliable internet connection. Certain roles will be required to utilize and or
download company-approved software.

â€¢ The individual must be prepared to work standard business hours in the
Pacific Time Zone

â€¢ Due to the nature of this role, we may verify backgrounds, including
conducting employment references, criminal records, and credit checks.

â€¢ Once hired, the successful candidate must provide a governmental photo ID
and proof of residential address as part of the onboarding process

**GREAT REASONS TO APPLY FOR THIS ROLE**

â€¢ Fully remote position allowing you to work from your home anywhere in the
world!

â€¢ Exciting and dynamic environment with a great leadership team

â€¢ Comprehensive training program and regular performance reviews to facilitate
your success

â€¢ Competitive compensation based on experience and proven abilities

â€¢ Great referral programs with incentives and bonuses

â€¢ Unbelievable product discounts when you use our products for your own
business

â€¢ A global workforce of multicultural and talented colleagues

â€¢ A close-knit operation with amazing growth opportunities for your personal
development

â€¢ A high-growth SaaS technology company publicly traded on the TSX Venture
Exchange

â€¢ Corporate headquarters in beautiful Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada

â€¢ Access to our education credits program and so much more!

**ABOUT US**

Founded in 2009, Wishpond is a rapidly growing technology company providing
digital marketing solutions targeted at small businesses. The cloud-based
platform includes landing pages, social promotions, website pop-ups, online
forms, and lead activity tracking. Wishpond has a dedicated team of
professional project managers, designers, copywriters, and developers who
provide marketing services tailored to our individual clients.

Wishpond serves over 3,000 customers in various industries and sizes, from
startups to large Fortune 500 companies. Wishpond has a rapidly growing global
headcount and continues to hire dedicated and qualified employees and
contractors who have what it takes to scale a successful software company.

To learn more about Wishpond Technologies, please visit our website or any of
our social media platforms:

Website: [www.wishpond.com](http://www.wishpond.com/)

Instagram: @wishpondofficial

Twitter: Wishpond

YouTube: Thewishpond

LinkedIn: Wishpond

**APPLICATION PROCESS**

**If you are interested in applying for this exciting opportunity, please
provide an updated resume IN ENGLISH (PDF or Word formats only), quoting the
position title in the subject line of your cover letter**

Wishpond Technologies is an equal-opportunity employer committed to hiring a
diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive culture that does not
discriminate on the basis of disability, status or any other basis protected
under legislation.

We thank all applicants in advance for their interest in this position;
however, due to the volume of applications we receive, we are unable to
respond to phone, email or agency inquiries.

## ğŸ›  å²—ä½èŒè´£

  * Infrastructure Ownership: Design, implement, and manage secure, highly available, and scalable infrastructure for blockchain nodes, sequencers, and related services.

  * Automation & Tooling: Develop CI/CD pipelines, infrastructure-as-code (IaC), and monitoring systems to ensure seamless deployments and minimal downtime.

  * Observability & Reliability: Build dashboards, alerts, and on-call systems to detect issues proactively and reduce mean time to recovery (MTTR).

  * Security & Compliance: Apply best practices for key management, secrets management, and infrastructure hardening to protect network integrity.

  * Performance & Scaling: Continuously optimize infrastructure for latency, throughput, and cost efficiency across multiple environments (testnets, mainnet, staging).

  * Collaboration: Work closely with blockchain engineers, protocol researchers, and SREs to support new feature rollouts and network upgrades.

**About Us:**

Anuttaconâ€™s mission is to create immersive and personalized virtual worlds
where players can form unique connections and deeper experiences in digital
spaces. We are dedicated to leveraging different perspectives, voices, and
backgrounds to promote a thoughtful and humanistic approach to technology.
Through research-driven and explorative AI, we aim to create real-time
interactions that seamlessly blend text, audio, visuals and beyond.

**About the Role:**

Weâ€™re looking for individuals with diverse expertise to join our data team as
AI Trainers. In this role, you will directly be involved in improving the
accuracy and performance of our models.

**Responsibilities:**

  * Annotate game content such as dialogues, quests, and character interactions

  * Utilize data evaluation tools to complete tasks through Verity Lab

  * Optimize player experiences through analyzing and providing insight on world building, comprehensive characters, mini-plots, personality profiles, and various topics

  * Collaborate with our AI research and product teams remotely to develop authentic and creative large language models 

**About you:**

  * Native or Fluent in English

  * Strong attention to detail and a commitment to producing high-quality work 

  * Comfortable learning new tools and software quickly

  * Ability to follow complex guidelines and apply them consistently

  * Communicate feedback clearly and professionally

**Preferred** :

  * Prior experience or strong interest in AI data, data annotation, or related fields 

  * Background or related experience in the following areas:

    * Storytelling, creative writing, copywriting, or content development

    * English, communications, or new media

    * Psychology, philosophy, or other fields focused on human behavior and thought

    * Game design or game development

    * STEM disciplines with a strong emphasis on clarity and structure

**Compensation & other expectations:**

  * Hourly rate: $20 - $30, depending on your role and qualifications. Compensation varies based on location and experience. International rates will differ.

  * Able to dedicate 20-40+ flexible hours per week based on your availability

  * There will be exciting opportunities for bonus and growth!

### How to Apply:

We offer AI Trainer roles in various tracks. Please complete any (or all) of
the following assessments, whichever suits your best interest. The
introductory questions will gather basic information about your location, work
background, and experience before the screener begins:

  * [LLM Assessment](https://www.anuttacon.com/job-detail/?id=24&tab=Overview)

  * [Audio Assessment](https://tinyurl.com/audio-anu)

  * [Video Assessment (General)](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSd-qKk-CsjwR64cyoqW2V8UbKY0KEufXqbjKGO-Ip-7q5e2oQ/viewform)

  * [Video Assessment (Understanding)](https://forms.gle/LvZEjoCfwHScABhg7)

  * [Writing Assessment](https://tinyurl.com/writing-gnr)

Please be advised that the screeners will test varying levels of skill, so do
not feel discouraged if a few of the questions are difficult. Based on your
areas of interest or expertise, you can complete one or more assessments to
start, or can change projects after youâ€™re onboarded.

We are eager to connect with candidates who have a passion for gaming,
especially those experienced in narrative games. If this resonates with you,
weâ€™d love to hear from you!

Lucia | Founding ML Engineer, Growth Engineer | Remote | Luciaprotocol.com

Lucia is changing how data can be used for growth and revenue generation. With
our open source SDK you can collect 10x the amount of data from your visitors
whether thatâ€™s in your website, web app or mobile app. Read more about us at
<https://docs.luciaprotocol.com>

Weâ€™re looking for a mix of positions.

\- Sr ML Engineer ($135k-240k)

\- Growth Engineer ($160k-170k)

â— Are self-motivated and can work independently

â— Driven to constantly learn and are always searching for the bigger picture

â— Strong in clear thinking and written communication

For the Growth Engineer: You will build the growth engine as a product. That
means rapid pipeline experiments, outbound tooling, segmentation, lead
scoring, and retention workflows built on real behavioral and on-chain
signals. You will ship scrappy tools and automations that turn messy data into
actions, and you will own outcomes, not activity.

For the Founding ML Engineer: You will build the intelligence core. That
includes models and systems that resolve pseudo-anonymous visitors into high
fidelity profiles, power a language interface for querying and decisioning,
and continuously improve prediction quality over time. You will work close to
the data, close to the product, and close to customers.

Please email apply[at]luciaprotocol[dot]com with the subject line HN + the
name of your role applying for, if this sounds like the right fit for you.

Join Spiralyze as a CRO Designer and shape the future of data-driven A/B
testing. Our US-based agency partners with major brands that excel in website
design. Now, we're leading the transition to a data-centric approach with
conversion as the primary goal.  
  
As our Designer, you'll collaborate closely with our ideation team, turning
wireframes and insights into compelling designs for A/B tests.  
  
You're a great fit if you:  
1\. Possess a stunning and versatile design style: Deliver the absolute best,
stay cutting-edge, and adapt to clients' brand requirements.  
2\. Are an effective collaborator: Embrace others' ideas, seek feedback, and
communicate openly and respectfully with clients and colleagues. Fight for
good design and prioritize the mission.  
  
Required skills:

  * Think in UI design: 3+ years of UI/UX design experience.
  * Excel in UI with bonus UX experience.
  * Expert in Figma: Create style libraries and handover files.
  * Familiarity with HTML, CSS, and responsive frameworks.
  * Stay updated on UI/UX trends.
  * Overlap with EST (New York time) for 4+ hours.
  * Excellent communication skills.

  
Benefits:

  * Cutting-edge work: Learn from leaders in CRO. See your designs come to life on popular websites.
  * Flexible working hours: Overlap with US Eastern Standard - Time for 4-5 hours, the rest of the day planning is yours.
  * Promotion opportunities: Grow, share knowledge, and advance within the company.
  * Technological reimbursement: Get the tools you need.
  * Education: Access company-sponsored courses and training.
  * Paid leave: Enjoy 20 days of all-purpose vacation leaves plus holidays.

  
Join Spiralyze, make an impact, and thrive in a rewarding role. Apply now.  
  
For your application to be considered, please include your resume,

**The Role:**

We are looking for a Senior Data Engineer specializing in modern, cloud-native
data platforms, with a strong focus on Amazon Web Services (AWS) and Python.
You will be responsible for designing, building, and optimizing highly
scalable and reliable ETL/ELT pipelines and data warehouses that power
analytics, machine learning, and business intelligence for our clients.

**What weâ€™re looking for:**

  * 5+ years of professional experience in data engineering
  * Expert proficiency in Python for data manipulation, scripting, and pipeline development (e.g., Pandas, PySpark).
  * Deep hands-on experience with the AWS cloud platform, specifically the core services used for data ingestion, storage, and processing (S3, Glue, Lambda, EMR).
  * Proven experience working with modern data warehouses (Snowflake, Amazon Redshift, or Google BigQuery/Azure Synapse).
  * Solid expertise in SQL and complex query writing/optimization.
  * Strong understanding of containerization and orchestration concepts (Docker, Kubernetes).
  * Fluent English communication skills.
  * Located in CET timezone (+/- 3 hours), we are unable to consider applications from candidates in other time zones.

**Nice-to-have:**

  * Experience with Infrastructure as Code (Terraform or CloudFormation).
  * Proficiency with a modern orchestration tool like Apache Airflow.
  * Familiarity with data streaming technologies (Kafka, Kinesis, or Flink).
  * AWS certifications

**Responsibilities:**

  * Architect, implement, and maintain scalable data pipelines (ETL/ELT) using Python and native AWS services to ingest data from various sources (APIs, databases, streaming services) into data lakes and warehouses.

  * Design robust and efficient data models (e.g., star schema, snowflake, data vault) for analytical and reporting needs.
  * Perform performance tuning and query optimization on large datasets within cloud data warehouses to ensure fast data delivery.
  * Implement infrastructure as code (IaC) using Terraform or CloudFormation, and integrate data pipelines into modern CI/CD processes.
  * Establish data quality monitoring, logging, alerting, and governance standards across the data platform.

### The Role:

We are looking for a Senior Azure DevOps Engineer for one of our clients who
would be responsible for ensuring the reliability, security, and scalability
of Azure-based systems. You are a perfect candidate if you are growth-
oriented, you love what you do, and you enjoy working on new ideas to develop
exciting products.

#### ****

#### What we are looking for:

  * 5+ years of proven experience as a DevOps Engineer with a strong focus on Azure.

  * In-depth knowledge of Azure services and architecture, including Azure VMs, Azure App Service, Azure Functions, and more.

  * Proficiency in scripting languages (e.g., PowerShell, Bash) and automation tools.

  * Experience with containerization and orchestration tools (Docker, Kubernetes, AKS).

  * Familiarity with Infrastructure as Code (IaC) principles and tools (ARM templates, Terraform).

  * Experience with version control systems (e.g., Git) and agile development methodologies.

  * Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.

  * Excellent communication and teamwork skills.

  * Located in the CET timezone (+/- 3 hours), we are unable to consider applications from candidates in other time zones.

#### Nice-to-have:

  * Azure certifications (e.g., Azure DevOps Engineer Expert) are a plus.

#### Responsibilities:

  * Design, implement, and manage scalable and highly available cloud infrastructure on Microsoft Azure.

  * Develop and maintain automation scripts using tools such as Azure Resource Manager (ARM) templates, Terraform, and scripting languages (e.g., PowerShell, Bash) to automate infrastructure provisioning and configuration.

  * Establish and optimise CI/CD pipelines using Azure DevOps, GitHub Actions, and other relevant tools to automate software deployment.

  * Implement and manage containerized applications using Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) and orchestrate containers using Docker and Kubernetes.

  * Implement Infrastructure as Code principles to define and manage infrastructure resources.

  * Set up monitoring and logging solutions using Azure Monitor, Azure Log Analytics, and other relevant tools to ensure the health and performance of Azure resources.

  * Implement security measures and best practices for Azure resources, ensuring a secure and compliant infrastructure.

  * Collaborate with development, operations, and security teams to understand requirements and implement effective cloud solutions.

  * Develop and maintain disaster recovery plans and ensure the resilience of Azure-based systems.

  * Identify and address performance bottlenecks, optimise Azure resources, and implement best practices for efficiency.

  * Create and maintain technical documentation for Azure infrastructure, deployment processes, and best practices.

  * Provide guidance and mentorship to junior DevOps engineers and team members, fostering a culture of continuous learning and improvement.

**Who We Are**

Hi, we're DuckDuckGo, the online protection company and remote-first team of
300+ on a mission to raise the standard of trust online. Founded in 2008 and
profitable since 2014, annual revenue now exceeds $100m USD and millions use
our browser on [Mac](https://spreadprivacy.com/introducing-duckduckgo-for-
mac/), [Windows](https://spreadprivacy.com/windows-browser-open-beta/),
[iOS](https://spreadprivacy.com/duckduckgo-privacy-browser-ios14/), and
[Android](https://spreadprivacy.com/introducing-app-tracking-protection/), our
[search engine](https://duckduckgo.com/), and the [DuckDuckGo
subscription](https://duckduckgo.com/pro). Our
[culture](https://duckduckgo.com/how-we-work) of trust, inclusivity, and
empowered project management underpins everything we do, where each team
member takes full ownership of their projects, from scoping and execution to
postmortem. If you're seeking end-to-end ownership of your work â€” you've come
to the right place!

**Your Team and Role**

Working on the People Operations Functional Team, youâ€™ll use your complex
tactical and strategic skills to boost organizational performance by
developing, enabling, and retaining talent in alignment with DuckDuckGo's core
values.

Recent projects include:

  * Restructuring our Performance Review Process for scalability; pushing decision-making farther down to functional teams

  * Clarifying accountability chains in our distributed leadership environment, across Career Advisors, Objective DRIs, Functional DRIs and other leadership roles

  * Creating automated Work Summaries that represent >80% of team membersâ€™ work to be delivered to everyone for self reflection and evaluations

As a Director, People Operations, youâ€™ll tackle ambiguous organizational
challenges using your sharply honed execution skills, deep fluency with data
and refined pragmatism that enables you to achieve ethical results quickly.
Most of your work will be with performance systems, like our bespoke annual
performance review process, mid-cycle check-ins and company-wide engagement
insofar as it delivers performance results.

**About You**

  * You process complexity with high-throughput; you achieve through hard work, leadership and efficiency, but **not** long hours.

  * You operate as a tactician; while you are conversant in strategy, you thrive in getting stuff done yourself as well.

  * You have experience facing ambiguous organizational performance challenges, chunking them out, and tackling them one by one, leading others as necessary.

  * You have proven experience building frameworks and approaches for problems that don't have obvious solutions or established playbooks / best practices.

  * You are able to deeply articulate your proposals through data and results; you are able to run experiments targeting expected outcomes.

  * You arenâ€™t afraid to show your work; you seek feedback on your initiatives before you reach diminishing returns and youâ€™re hungry for othersâ€™ input to improve outcomes. 

  * You are comfortable and adept at operating in a concise, asynchronous environment while building relationships cross-functionally to operationalize your initiatives.

  * You have a knack for translating culture into principles, protocols and algorithms, but keeping the heart in it.

**Compensation**

**$243,800** **USD annually** and stock options. Compensation is [identical
within professional levels](https://duckduckgo.com/how-we-work), regardless of
geographic location or team. Compensation for each professional level is
transparent across the organization.

Eligibility for company-sponsored health benefits is limited to team members
based in the United States. This program does not extend to team members
located in other countries, such as Canada or the UK.

Our[ Team Member Support
Guide](https://duckduckgo.com/assets/hiring/team_support_guide.pdf) explains
how we prioritize your wellbeing including **paid parental leave, office
setup,** and **co-working allowances.**

**Hiring Process**

Hiring works best when it's a two-way street. Learn how we help you get to
know DuckDuckGo, envision your future role here, and find out more about [how
we hire](https://duckduckgo.com/how-we-hire).

**Diversity, Equity and Inclusion**

DuckDuckGo provides equal work opportunities to all team members and
applicants, and it prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type on the
basis of race, color, ethnicity, caste, religion, age, sex (including
pregnancy), national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran
status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other
characteristic protected by our policies or federal, state, or local laws.

We want to ensure that our hiring process is accessible. If you need
reasonable accommodation for any part of the application process because of a
medical condition or disability, please send an email to
[careers@duckduckgo.com](mailto:careers@duckduckgo.com) to let us know the
nature of your request.

**Please note that:**

    1. Youâ€™ll be required to attend meetings on camera via video conferencing

    2. Expect to travel at least two times a year: once for our all-hands meetup and again for a team retreat (each around 4-5 days). While extenuating circumstances may impact attendance, everyone is strongly encouraged to attend.

    3. While we offer a flexible work arrangement with no core hours, expect an average full-time commitment of 40 hours per week.

    4. A successful candidate must pass a background check as a condition of joining the team.

    5. By applying for this role, you confirm that all information submitted is accurate and complete. You further acknowledge that providing false or fraudulent information during the application process is cause for denial of an offer, revocation of any existing offer, or other adverse action, up to and including termination after the start of your commencement of work.

**Disclosure Statement: Use of AI in Hiring Process**

As part of our commitment to enhancing our recruitment process, we utilize
artificial intelligence (AI) technology to assist in reviewing and summarizing
job applications and test projects, including those tools integrated into our
recruitment vendor platforms. We use AI to flag potentially fraudulent
applications, analyze and summarize applicantsâ€™ experience, interviews, and
project performance, and help streamline our selection process.

**Key Principles:**

      1. **Data Privacy:** All information provided in your application will be handled in accordance with our [Recruiting Privacy Policy](https://duckduckgo.com/static-assets/files/pages/careers/DuckDuckGo-Recruiting-Privacy-Policy-effective-February-5-2025.pdf). We ensure that your personal information is protected and used solely for recruitment purposes.

      2. **Human Oversight and Accountability:** The AI technology is designed to support our hiring team by providing insights and summaries of applications and evaluations of test projects against scoring rubrics. All final evaluations and hiring decisions, however, will be made by our hiring team, who will consider the AI's input alongside other factors.

      3. **Transparency:** We believe in transparency regarding our hiring practices. If you have any questions about how AI is used in our recruitment process, please feel free to reach out to us.

By submitting your application, you acknowledge and consent to the use of AI
technology in our review process. If you would like to request an alternative
selection process, please contact us as at
[careers@duckduckgo.com](mailto:careers@duckduckgo.com). Thank you for your
interest in joining DuckDuckGo!

postTitle: Intern Business/System Analyst (worldwide remote, work anywhere) at CloudLinux
jobTitle: Intern Business/System Analyst (worldwide remote, work anywhere) at CloudLinux
descContent:
We are looking for an **Intern Business Analyst** to join our CloudLinux
Network (CLN) team.

CLN is a core platform that powers billing, licensing, and customer management
across our products and brands (CloudLinux and TuxCare brands, including
CloudLinux OS, Imunify, KernelCare, Extended Lifecycle Support, and Enterprise
Support products). It serves thousands of global customers and directly
impacts revenue, customer trust, and user experience.

As an Intern BA, you will work closely with the Product Owner to support the
delivery of new product features, improve internal workflows, analyze
requirements, and ensure the smooth operation of key business processes. You
will contribute to billing logic, licensing flows, permissions, API
improvements, and UX consistency across the platform.

  
This role is ideal for someone with 1+ years of experience who wants rapid
growth in a complex product environment.

**As an Intern Business Analyst, you will:**

  * Write and maintain product requirements, user stories, acceptance criteria, and use-case scenarios.
  * Support feature development for billing, subscriptions, licensing, permissions, and customer workflows.
  * Participate in planning sessions, standups, grooming meetings, retrospectives, and design reviews as a full member of the CLN team.
  * Assist in resolving customer-impacting issues.
  * Collect user and stakeholder feedback to refine product usability and discoverability.
  * Work with data teams to analyze billing-related tickets, refund patterns, subscription events, and customer behaviors.
  * Preparing structured summaries and insights from raw data.
  * Performing manual data review or manual data entry when needed (e.g., testing edge cases, validating billing scenarios, helping diagnose customer issues).
  * Supporting internal cleanup and data-quality initiatives.

**Requirements**

**To be successful in this role, you should have:**

  * 1+ year of experience as an Intern Business Analyst, or in a similar product role.
  * Ability to create clear, structured requirements.
  * Basic understanding of REST APIs (Swagger, request/response flow, error codes).
  * Basic knowledge of Postman. 
  * Knowledge of SQL or experience with BI tools (Looker, Redash, Snowflake).
  * Technical background or understanding of JSON, logs, and API debugging.
  * Strong analytical thinking and attention to detail.
  * English - Advanced. 

**Nice-to-have:**

  * Experience with billing systems or financial workflows.

  * Familiarity with Jira, Confluence, Notion, Slite, or similar tools.

**Personal skills:**

  * Fast-learning and proactive.
  * Strong ownership and self-organization.
  * Comfortable working in a fast-paced, distributed team.
  * Able to analyze tasks independently and propose logical solutions.
  * Excellent communication and teamwork skills.

**Internship details:**

  * 6 months internship with the opportunity to transition to a full-time contract in case of successful completion of the internship

**Benefits**

**What's in it for you?**

  * Work on real project tasks in an Agile team

  * A strong focus on professional development with opportunities for learning and growth:
    * Interesting and challenging projects,
    * Mentor and other knowledge-exchange programs, 
  * Fully remote work with flexible working hours, that allows you to schedule your day and work from any location worldwide;
  * 10 days of national holidays, and unlimited sick leaves to ensure you maintain a healthy work-life balance;
  * Compensation for private medical insurance;
  * Co-working and gym/sports reimbursement;
  * The opportunity to receive a reward for the most innovative idea that the company can patent, fostering a culture of creativity and innovation.

_By applying for this position, you consent to the processing of your personal
data as described in our Privacy Policy (_<https://cloudlinux.com/candidate-
privacy-notice>_), which provides detailed information on how we maintain and
handle your data._

postTitle: Kernel Build Engineer Intern (worldwide remote, work anywhere) at CloudLinux
jobTitle: Kernel Build Engineer Intern (worldwide remote, work anywhere) at CloudLinux
descContent:
We are seeking motivated**Kernel Build Engineer Interns** to join the
CloudLinux team. As an Intern, you will gain hands-on experience working with
Linux kernel builds, packaging, and automation that support our KernelCare and
Endless Lifecycle Support (ELS) products.

CloudLinux is a leading provider of Linux-based operating systems and security
solutions for web hosting providers. Our products, including CloudLinux OS,
KernelCare, and Imunify360, are used by thousands of companies worldwide.

**In this role, you will have the opportunity to:**

  * Build and package Linux kernel components from source
  * Apply patches and work with kernel configuration files
  * Maintain build workflows and patch flows using Git
  * Work with Docker-based build environments
  * Develop and maintain automation scripts for build and CI-related tasks
  * Participate in documenting and improving internal build processes

**Requirements**

**Qualificatuions weâ€™re looking for:**

  * Experience with GNU/Linux operating system and confident CLI usage
  * Understanding of how software and packages are built from source
  * Experience using Git for development and patch/branch management
  * Experience with Docker
  * Experience writing automation scripts using Python, Go, or JavaScript  
Some familiarity with C code

  * English proficiency at B1 level or above

**Benefits**

**What's in it for you?**

  * A focus on professional development.
  * Interesting and challenging projects.
  * Fully remote work with flexible working hours, which allows you to schedule your day and work from any location worldwide.
  * Paid vacation, 10 days of national holidays, and unlimited sick leaves.
  * Compensation for private medical insurance.
  * Co-working and gym/sports reimbursement.
  * Budget for education.
  * The opportunity to receive a reward for the most innovative idea that the company can patent.

By applying for this position, you consent to the processing of your personal
data as described in our Privacy Policy (<https://cloudlinux.com/candidate-
privacy-notice>), which provides detailed information on how we maintain and
handle your data.

WHY YOU SHOULD APPLY:

Coalition Technologies is devoted to delivering clients the highest quality
work while providing our team a fun, thriving, and innovative environment.
Along with the opportunity for tremendous career growth and rapid advancement,
CT offers:

  * The most competitive profit-sharing bonus plan in the industry, paying up to 50% of company profits to full-time employees each month!
  * A highly competitive Paid Time Off plan, promoting quality work-life balance.
  * Subsidized gym memberships to help team members feel their best.
  * Medical, dental, vision, and life insurance packages for all US-based team members.
  * International Health Insurance Reimbursement Program for all international team members, a benefit unique to Coalition.
  * Device upgrade and learning reimbursement programs.
  * Motivating career development plans with clearly defined goals and rewards.
  * Additional job-specific incentives and bonuses.  
  

Plus, 100% of our team works remotely with the support of time tracking
software. Our company culture specializes in supporting remote team members,
and weâ€™ve been doing so for more than a decade. CT welcomes your application,
wherever in the world it's coming from!

YOU SHOULD HAVE:

  * Willingness to learn, grow, and collaborate with the team and company as a whole.
  * Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  * A high level of discretion, ethics, and trustworthiness.
  * Intermediate spreadsheet skills (preferred)
  * Innovative thinking and a willingness to challenge existing methods where improvement is possible.
  * Experience in bookkeeping / financial record keeping (preferred).
  * Experience with Google Sheets or Excel, Quickbooks Online, and G-Suite (preferred).
  * The availability to work 40 hours per week from 9:00 am to 6:00 pm PST.
  * A reliable space to work remotely with a fast computer, quality internet, camera, microphone, and speakers.

YOUR DUTIES AND TASKS:

  * Answering phones and emails.
  * Completing entry-level bookkeeping, including recording expenses, organizing receipts, and completing other transaction records.
  * Resolving billing issues with clients and internal team members.
  * Providing account access, usage reports, data analysis, and other ad hoc requests for team members.
  * Supporting quality assurance checks of various internal and client facing reporting.
  * Organizing new client contracts, create invoices, and process client payments.
  * Contributing to internal database maintenance, upkeep and data entry.
  * Researching, ordering, & distributing company-wide gifts (2-3 times per year).
  * Organizing company events, competitions, and special projects throughout the year.
  * Facilitating company holiday, time off, and schedule variation calendars.

We are looking for talented and diligent candidates who excel in our skills
tests, and will consider these candidates even if past experience or
educational background criteria aren't met.

*California, New York, Washington, and Colorado: starting base pay for this position ranges between $15 - $25 per hour.

Compensation may vary based on factors such as experience, qualifications,
skills test performance, geographic location, and seniority of the position
offered. Outside of California, New York, Washington, and Colorado
compensation may fall outside the above ranges.

jobTitle: Executive Assistant & Accountability Partner (Fullâ€‘Time, Remote, ET Hours) at N/A
descContent:
**About the role**

We are seeking a collegeâ€‘educated, highâ€‘judgment Executive Assistant to
partner with a CEO and spouse across work and family operations. This is a 40
hrs/week, longâ€‘term role in Eastern Time (ET). You will run complex calendars
and travel, keep our â€œfamily operating systemâ€ tight, act as a gentle
accountability coach for both principals, and prepare bill payments within a
clear approvals workflow. Weâ€™re looking for someone who leads upâ€”proactive,
thoughtful, and comfortable prompting us toward better outcomes.

**What youâ€™ll own**

  * Calendar & inbox mastery: Orchestrate a fast, highâ€‘stakes calendar; defend focus time; draft agendas/briefs; triage email.  
  

  * Travel endâ€‘toâ€‘end: Book smart, flexible itineraries (US/UK time zones), leverage card/travel benefits, manage changes.  
  

  * Family OS (Google: Maintain a living hub of contacts, vendors, renewals, school/athletics dates, medical appointments, SOPs.  
  

  * Accountability coaching:  
  

    * Weekly 15â€‘min 1:1 with each principal to set 3 personal goals and one weekly â€œkeystone,â€  
  

    * Midâ€‘week nudges,  
  

    * Friday 15â€‘min readout (progress, blockers, next experiment).  
  

  * Vendors & projects: Coordinate household vendors; manage multiâ€‘week projects with crisp updates and measurable checkpoints.  
  

  * Billâ€‘pay prep (simple & safe):  
  

    * Draft bills in BILL (formerly Bill.com) with roleâ€‘based approvals (you prepare; principals approve),  
  

    * Use 1Password for shared credentials (leastâ€‘privilege access),  
  

    * Use Privacy virtual cards for subscriptions/incidentals (merchantâ€‘locked, spend caps).  
  

  * Documentation & improvement: Keep SOPs current; propose improvements; measure what matters.  
  

**You bring**

  * Bachelorâ€™s degree from an accredited university.  
  

  * 5+ years supporting a founder/CEO or senior executive (remote OK).  
  

  * Exceptional written communication and executive judgment.  
  

  * Demonstrated ability to lead upâ€”anticipate needs, push back diplomatically, and improve the system.  
  

  * Tool fluency: Google Workspace, BILL, 1Password, Privacy (or quick to learn equivalents).  
  

  * Comfortable coordinating across US/UK time zones.  
  

  * Located anywhere and able to work ET hours.  
  

**Nice to have**

  * Exposure to coaching principles (e.g., ICFâ€‘style accountability, active listening), project tools (Asana/ClickUp), and travel perks (e.g., Amex FHR/Virtuoso).  
  

**Compensation & terms**

  * Salary

  * Retention bonuses 

  * Performance bonus opportunity tied to measurable outcomes (calendar health, onâ€‘time deliverables, SLA).  
  

**How to apply**

Please submit the following.Do not use AI to generate:

  1. Resume (1 page) and 150â€‘word note on a complex calendar or travel problem you solved,  
  

  2. A short writing sample youâ€™re proud of (max 300 words),  
  

Weâ€™ll invite selected candidates to a 15â€‘minute cognitive assessment and a
paid practical (60â€“90 min: inbox triage, ET calendar rebuild, and a BOSâ†”LHR
travel brief).  

**Trust & background**

Finalists will complete reference checks, a background check, and sign an NDA.

WhiteBridge-Ltd is a young and rapidly developing company working in the field
of digital markets and analytics. We bring together enterprising people who
want to master modern approaches to trading, analysis and decision-making in a
dynamic market environment.

We are currently looking for a **Junior Crypto Analyst & Trader**, a novice
specialist who is ready to complete training, perform real trading operations
and develop under the guidance of experienced mentors.

### Your Responsibilities

  * Execution and support of trading operations on digital markets.
  * Tracking asset dynamics and market trends.
  * Maintaining internal records on transactions and statistics.
  * Analyzing market data, news, and charts for decision-making.
  * Work with analytical tools and participate in discussions with a team of traders.
  * The gradual formation and improvement of your own trading strategy.

### What We Offer

  * Working for a young and growing international company.
  * Remote format â€” you can work from anywhere in the world.
  * Flexible schedule â€” up to 20 hours per week, convenient to combine with study or main activity.
  * Learning from scratch â€” all processes and trading tools are mastered with a mentor.
  * The opportunity for professional growth and transition to more advanced levels.

### Ideal Candidate Profile

  * Genuine interest in crypto markets, blockchain technology, or financial trading â€” curiosity is more important than prior experience.
  * Readiness to learn quickly, adapt, and develop new skills from zero.
  * Careful, accurate and attentive to detail â€” especially when handling real market operations.
  * Able to work independently, manage time effectively, and stay organized in a remote role.
  * Responsible, reliable, and committed to following through on tasks.
  * Motivated to improve and grow within the company.
  * English level B2 or above â€” required to understand analytics, educational materials, tools, and international news.

We are hiring a **contract-based****Senior Frontend Developer** for the
garden3d creative collective

**Original job post link:**

[**Senior Frontend Developer**](https://www.notion.so/garden3d/Senior-
Frontend-Developer-2c6131fea2c780dea224d76e942c6311?source=copy_link)

## ğŸŒ **About garden3d**

We are worker owned creative collective, innovating on everything from brands
and IRL communities to IoT devices and cross platform apps. We share profit,
open source everything, spin out new businesses, and invest in exciting ideas
through financial and/or in-kind contributions.

****

Our client roster includes[Google](https://www.google.com/),
[Stripe](https://stripe.com/), [Figma](https://www.figma.com/),
[Hinge](https://hinge.co/), [Black Socialists in
America](https://blacksocialists.us/), [ACLU](https://www.aclu.org/),
[Pratt](https://www.pratt.edu/),
[Parsons](https://www.newschool.edu/parsons/),
[Mozilla](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/), [The Nobel
Prize](https://www.nobelprize.org/), [MIT](https://www.mit.edu/),
[Gnosis](https://www.gnosis.io/), [Etsy](https://www.etsy.com/) &
[Gagosian](https://gagosian.com/). Weâ€™re the software team behind innovative
products like [The Light Phone](https://www.thelightphone.com/) &
[Mill](https://www.mill.com/), and a global, decentralized community space
collective called [Index Space](https://www.index-space.org/).

We think of our garden3d as collective for creative people, prioritizing a
happy, talented, and diverse studio culture. We work on projects that bring
value to our world, and we balance deep care for the work we do with a genuine
curiosity about life outside of our jobs.

## ğŸ”® **Who weâ€™re looking for:**

We're looking for a **Senior Frontend Developer** who excels at building
pixel-perfect websites using modern frontend frameworks. You'll collaborate
with our team to build elegant, performant, and visually stunning web
experiences. Your work will span a diverse range of client projects, from
immersive brand websites to complex web applications, all requiring a keen eye
for detail and technical excellence.

In this role, youâ€™ll work on a variety of client projects to find cost-
effective, high-quality, pragmatic solutions to complex problems.
Responsibilities will include:

  * Collaborating with Technical Lead to meet clients' development needs
  * Building and maintaining high-performance web applications with modern frontend frameworks and tools
  * Implementing responsive, accessible, and pixel-perfect user interfaces based on design specifications
  * Integrating frontend applications with headless CMS platforms, APIs, and third-party services
  * Optimizing application performance, including bundle size, load times, and runtime efficiency
  * Architecting scalable component libraries and design systems for consistency across projects
  * Writing clear documentation for code maintenance and usage
  * Participating in project team meetings, including Sprint Planning, daily standups, and retrospectives
  * Participating in code reviews, providing constructive feedback to teammates and ensuring adherence to best practices

The person weâ€™re looking for is happy, relaxed and easy to get along with.
Theyâ€™re flexible on anything except conceits that will lower their usually
outstanding work quality. They work â€œsmartâ€, by carefully managing their
workflow and staggering features that have dependencies intelligently â€” they
prefer deep work but are OK coming up to the surface now and then for top
level / strategic conversations.

We believe people with backgrounds or interests in design, art, music, food or
fashion tend to have a well rounded sense of design & quality â€” so a variety
of hobbies or side projects is a big nice to have!

**ğŸ”‘ Must Have Competencies:**

Weâ€™re always pitching for new and exciting technology niches. Some of the
areas below are relevant to us!

  * 8+ years writing highly performant frontend code, an obsession for 95+ Lighthouse scores
  * Expert level experience with Typescript, and one of Next.js, Nuxt, Svelte, Vue
  * Extensive experience with headless CMS like Sanity, Contentful, Prismic or more
  * Fluency in industry standard PaaS like Vercel, Netlify, Firebase, etc
  * Fluency in eCommerce technologies like Shopify (headless & liquid), Stripe, Swell and others
  * Experience building accessible, responsive interfaces with attention to performance optimization and SEO best practices
  * Strong understanding of modern CSS methodologies (Tailwind, CSS Modules, etc) and animation libraries
  * Experience with state management solutions (Redux, Zustand, Pinia) and API integration patterns
  * Proficiency with testing frameworks (Jest, Playwright, Cypress) and commitment to writing maintainable, well-documented code
  * Experience with design systems and component libraries, working closely with designers to ensure pixel-perfect implementations
  * **Real-time & performance optimization**: experience with WebSockets for live data updates, caching strategies (Redis, CDN-level caching), CDN configuration and optimization (Cloudflare, Fastly), and image optimization techniques including proxies and delivery networks

ğŸ’ª **Nice to Have Competencies:**

Weâ€™re always pitching for new and exciting technology niches. Some of the
areas below are relevant to us!

  * **WebGL & Canvas expertise**: experience building interactive graphics, animations, and visualizations using WebGL, Three.js, or native Canvas API
  * **Data visualization** : creating compelling, interactive data visualizations with libraries like Mapbox, D3.js, Chart.js, or similar tools
  * **Full-stack development experience** : comfortable working across the entire stack, from frontend to backend and database layers
  * **PostgreSQL expertise** : strong experience with database design, query optimization, and managing complex relational data structures
  * **GraphQL & API design**: building and maintaining GraphQL or REST APIs with a focus on performance and developer experience
  * **Real-time technologies** : experience with WebSockets, Server-Sent Events, or similar technologies for building live, interactive features
  * **Authentication & security**: implementing secure authentication flows (OAuth, JWT) and following security best practices
  * **Client-facing experience** : working directly with customers to gather requirements and provide technical solutions
  * **Product management experience** : defining product roadmaps and collaborating closely with stakeholders
  * **Engineering management experience** : leading teams, setting technical direction, and mentoring developers

## ğŸ’¸ **Compensation**

Our pay scale ranges from **`$35 p/hr` to **`**$95 p/hr**` pending seniority
(& team leadership experience), and our projects are rarely less than 8 full
time weeks at 40 hours per week.

We prefer long standing relationships with highly accountable and
communicative team members, so we encourage candidates to expect longer term
engagements.

## ğŸ¤ **How we interview:**

Our interview process starts with a call where you get to meet a few members
of our team. From there weâ€™ll ask appropriate candidates to take part in a
technical exercise which helps illustrate skill level and comfort.

â†’ Itâ€™s also a great way to see what itâ€™s like to work with us and help support
folks who may not have the â€˜right titleâ€™ but have the experience and technical
know-how for the role.

## ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ­ **How we work:**

We believe that thereâ€™s a better balance between the poles of freelancing &
full time, and for that reason Sanctuary works differently to most shops:

  * [**Transparency & Ownership:**](https://sanctucompu.substack.com/p/our-open-source-2020-profit-and-loss) We release out Profit & Loss statements to the community each year, open source our best ideas, and talk business & money with everyone in the company. Weâ€™re proud to run our business with integrity, and for that reason we share everything with our team & community.
  * [150% Carbon Negative:](https://negative.sanctuary.computer/) Our studio offsets 150% of the carbon we use to do business each year, dated back to our founding in 2015. We turn down work that is not in-line with our morals, and we encourage our peers to do the same. [We have been certified climate neutral since 2021](https://twitter.com/sanctucompu/status/1385282161197060100).
  * [Strong Morals:](https://sanctucompu.substack.com/p/our-moral-compass) Since our founding, we've turned down somewhere between $1mm - $2mm of work that didn't meet our moral standards. (Most of that was DTC brands that can't show a valid sustainability initiative).
  * **Async & Decentralized:** We use tools optimized for calm, thoughtful communication, and opt for async whenever possible. We fight hard to maintain our focus time.
  * **Remote Friendly:** Our company is fluent in remote work, making our workplace more decentralized, and democratized in the process.
  * **Ideas & Products:** In our spare studio time, we work to build our own open source or internal products to diversify & bolster our income. We create amazing technology products for our clients, so why not for the studio?

**â†’ Read more on our[Substack, over here](https://sanctucompu.substack.com/),
or our [Medium, over there](https://medium.com/sanctuary-computer-inc).**

****

### **About the Role  
**

**Stack Influence** is a venture backed marketplace platform that automates
collaborations between eCommerce brands and everyday social media creators. We
are a high-growth, remote-first startup.  
  
Stack Influence is hiring a versatile, data-driven **Digital Marketing
Manager** to join our team, reporting directly to the Head of Growth.

We are looking for someone who has moved past the "novice" phase of Google Ads
and is ready to own B2B campaigns, but who also possesses a wider skillset to
support broader marketing initiatives. As we launch a new website and manage
team coverage, agility is key.

You will primarily focus on Paid Acquisition, but you will also play a key
role in supporting our new websiteâ€™s SEO strategy, ensuring content continuity
when needed, and assisting with a variety of marketing initiatives. If you
understand how to drive leads for B2B, but can also speak the language of
eCommerce brands, you will fit right in.

**Salary is between $60K â€“ $80K CAD.**  
  

### **Key Responsibilities**

**1\. Google Ads & Paid Media (Primary Focus)**

  * **Campaign Management:** Build, optimize, and scale Google Ads campaigns (Search, Display, and Discovery) with a focus on high-quality B2B lead generation.
  * **Landing Page Optimization:** Collaborate on landing page strategy to improve Quality Scores and Conversion Rates.
  * **Analytics:** Deep dive into Google Analytics 4 (GA4) to track user behavior, attribution, and ROI.
  * **ECommerce Alignment:** Leverage any past experience with eCommerce brands to better understand our target market and craft messaging that resonates with DTC founders and marketing managers.

**2\. SEO & Web Development Support**

  * **New Site Updates:** Assist the team with expansion of our new Webflow website (blog evolution, landing page creation, content/copy updates, etc). You will help ensure SEO best practices are maintained during new site updates.
  * **SEO Tools:** Utilize Ahrefs and Google Search Console to monitor traffic health and identify keyword opportunities.

**3\. Content Operations (Coverage & Support)**

  * **Content Continuity:** Provide backup coverage for our content team. You should be comfortable stepping in to manage the blogging cadence, ad creation, and marketing material development when required.
  * **AI-Driven Workflow:** Utilize AI tools to research topics and draft blog posts, editing them to ensure they meet our quality standards and SEO requirements. Creating AI automations to streamline a variety of marketing initiatives.

**4\. Marketing Operations**

  * **HubSpot CRM:** Assist in tracking leads through the funnel, analyzing & creating reports, working with hubspot forms, etc.
  * **New Marketing Initiatives:** Assist with a variety of different marketing initiatives like newsletter marketing, outbound email marketing campaigns, new ad channels, etc.
  * **Marketing Automations:** Assist with setting up cross software automations with Zapier, implementing new AI marketing automations, and creating streamlined workflows.  
  

### **What Weâ€™re Looking For**

  * **Experience:** 2â€“4+ years of digital marketing experience.
  * **Mindset:** Avid learner who is a team player but also can spearhead new initiatives.
  * **B2B Ads Proficiency:** You have run ads for B2B companies before and understand the nuances of lead quality vs. quantity.
  * **SEO Literacy:** You understand the fundamentals of technical SEO well enough to assist with a site migration without tanking rankings.
  * **Tech Stack:**
    * **Must Have:** Google Ads Manager, Google Analytics (GA4), Google Search Console, and AI tool experience (ChatGPT, Perplexity, etc)
    * **Strongly Preferred:** HubSpot, Ahrefs (or Semrush), Webflow, and Zapier.  
  

### **"Nice to Haves" (Bonus Points)**

  * **E-commerce Brand Experience:** Since our clients are primarily e-commerce brands, having experience working  _for_ or  _with_ DTC/E-comm companies is a massive plus.
  * **Influencer Marketing Platform Experience:** Since our clients are looking for influencer marketing services having experience working for an influencer company is a plus.
  * **B2B Marketing Channel Knowledge:** Have experience running PR campaigns, managing a variety of different B2B ad platforms (LInkedin, Meta, Reddit, etc), running social media marketing campaigns, and developing outbound ABM email campaigns.

### **Why Join Stack Influence?**

  * **Scaling Startup:** Stack Influence is a VC-funded startup, one of the leading influencer marketing platforms, and on a mission to allow brands and everyday people to exchange value and creativity without barriers.
  * **Growth Potential:** You will report directly to the Head of Growth and work with the C-Suite giving you a front-row seat to high-level strategy.
  * **Variety:** You won't be siloed into just one button-pushing task. Youâ€™ll touch Ads, SEO, content, and a variety of marketing initiatives.
  * **Tools:** We embrace modern workflows (AI, Automation) to make your job more efficient.
  * **Impact:** We are a platform where your work directly correlates to the companyâ€™s revenue. You won't be a cog in a wheel.
  * **Autonomy:** We value results over micro-management. You will have the freedom to test new ideas.
  * **Remote:** We are a fully remote team allowing you to work on your own schedule from anywhere you desire (as long as you are available to coordinate with team schedules).

* * *
