postTitle: Senior Blockchain Engineer- Remote, Worldwide at Nethermind
jobTitle: Senior Blockchain Engineer- Remote, Worldwide at Nethermind
descContent:
**Are you the one?**

We are looking for an experienced and motivated Senior Blockchain Engineer to
design and build secure, high-performance blockchain solutions for
institutional and enterprise clients.

You will design and implement blockchain-based systems across the web3
ecosystem: from protocol-level components and smart contracts to Institutional
DeFi and enterprise-grade financial applications.

This remote-first role involves deep collaboration with internal engineering
and research teams, as well as external partners such as financial
institutions, infrastructure providers, and blockchain foundations.

You should bring strong proficiency in one or more general-purpose programming
languages and hands-on experience developing smart contracts in Solidity. A
deep understanding of Ethereumâ€™s architecture, solid engineering fundamentals,
and a disciplined approach to problem-solving are essential.

The ideal candidate communicates clearly, writes maintainable code, and
thrives in complex, multi-stakeholder environments. Knowledge of non-EVM
chains, zero-knowledge proofs, and institutional DeFi protocols is highly
valued.

**Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:**

  * Design, develop, and maintain applications and services built on blockchain infrastructure.

  * Build, test, and deploy secure smart contracts for Institutional Grade protocols (primarily in Solidity).

  * Debug, profile, and optimize on-chain and off-chain components.

  * Integrate blockchain data and transactions into enterprise-grade systems.

  * Develop tooling and automation scripts for blockchain operations.

  * Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams and external partners.

  * Keep abreast of evolving blockchain protocols, tooling, and standards.

**Technical Skills:**

  * 5+ years of professional software development experience, including 3+ years of Solidity or equivalent smart contract programming.

  * Proven track record in building, testing, and deploying complex, production-grade smart contracts using toolchains such as Foundry, Hardhat, or Remix.

  * Strong programming skills in one or more general-purpose languages such as Go, Rust, Python, TypeScript/JavaScript, C#, Java, or Kotlin.

  * Solid understanding of algorithms, data structures, and computational efficiency.

  * Strong grasp of software architecture, design principles, and modern engineering processes.

  * Ability to write clean, testable, and maintainable code that balances simplicity and scalability.

  * Deep understanding of Ethereum architecture, including its execution model, transaction lifecycle, and core components.

  * Practical knowledge of the Institutional DeFi ecosystem â€” lending/borrowing protocols, AMMs, perpetuals, vaults, tokenization, and stablecoins.

  * Experience building off-chain services and integrations that interact with web3 protocols using libraries such as ethers.js or web3.js.

**Other Competencies:**

  * You need to be a self-starter with the curiosity and drive to continuously improve.

  * Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills, with attention to detail

  * Strong written and verbal communication and collaboration skills

  * Proven ability to operate in distributed teams and collaborate across organizational boundaries (engineering, research, and client stakeholders)

  * Proficiency in English

**Nice to have:**

  * Experience with L2 networks (Starknet, Optimism, zkSync, Arbitrum).

  * Familiarity with cryptographic primitives (hashing, signature schemes, zk-proof systems).

  * Understanding of financial instruments and tokenization use cases.

  * Experience with smart contract security auditing and formal verification tools.

  * Front-end development experience (React, Angular) is a plus.

  * DevOps or infrastructure setup for blockchain networks (private/testnet deployments).

**What We Offer/ Benefits**

  * **Flexible Work Options** : Remote-first culture with the opportunity to work from anywhere.

  * **Global and Diverse Workforce:** You'll work with people from various backgrounds and cultures.

  * **Learning and Development** : You'll work on innovative, challenging projects and have access to experts and mentors to enhance your skills.

  * **Career Growth** : Access to training, mentorship, and opportunities to contribute to open-source initiatives.

  * **Global Events and Conferences:** Opportunities to attend the industry events.

  * **Collaborative and Innovative Culture:** We foster teamwork and encourage new ideas.

  * **Unlimited Time Off** : Enjoy the freedom to structure your working hours in a way that suits you best, with the flexibility to take unpaid time off whenever needed to maintain a healthy work-life balance.

**Our Commitment to Diversity**

At Nethermind, we celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an
inclusive environment for all team members. We believe a variety of
perspectives drives innovation and leads to better solutions for the
blockchain community.

**Ready to Join Us?**

If you're passionate about blockchain and eager to make an impact, weâ€™d love
to hear from you. Click **Apply for this job** to start your journey with
Nethermind.

**About the Role**

Shape the future of Web3 by building fast, high-quality frontend applications.
As a key part of our team, youâ€™ll design and develop core features to create a
smooth and responsive user experience. Youâ€™ll work closely with product,
design, and blockchain teams to bring ideas to life from start to finish.

**Core Responsibilities**

Architect, develop, and maintain high-performance, responsive web applications
using modern frontend technologies

Collaborate closely with product, design, and blockchain teams to deliver
exceptional user experiences

Build pixel-perfect UI components from Figma mockups and design assets

Debug and troubleshoot issues across the full web stack

**Qualifications**

Bachelorâ€™s in Computer Science or related field, or equivalent experience

3+ years in frontend development, with 1+ years in Web3/DeFi

Expertise in JavaScript, TypeScript, React ecosystem

Solid understanding of web performance optimization and best practices

Experience with [Web3.js](http://Web3.js), [Ethers.js](http://Ethers.js), and
an understanding of Web3 principles (wallets, smart contracts)

**Soft Skills:**

Basic English verbal and written communication skills are required

Strong collaboration abilities in a remote, cross-functional team

Ownership mindset - â€œyou build it, you run itâ€

Problem-solving skills with attention to detail

Quick learner in a fast-paced environment

**About the Role**

Shape the future of Web3 by building fast, high-quality frontend applications.
As a key part of our team, youâ€™ll design and develop core features to create a
smooth and responsive user experience. Youâ€™ll work closely with product,
design, and blockchain teams to bring ideas to life from start to finish.

**Core Responsibilities**

Architect, develop, and maintain high-performance, responsive web applications
using modern frontend technologies

Collaborate closely with product, design, and blockchain teams to deliver
exceptional user experiences

Build pixel-perfect UI components from Figma mockups and design assets

Debug and troubleshoot issues across the full web stack

**Qualifications**

Bachelorâ€™s in Computer Science or related field, or equivalent experience

3+ years in frontend development, with 1+ years in Web3/DeFi

Expertise in JavaScript, TypeScript, React ecosystem

Solid understanding of web performance optimization and best practices

Experience with [Web3.js](http://Web3.js), [Ethers.js](http://Ethers.js), and
an understanding of Web3 principles (wallets, smart contracts)

**Soft Skills:**

Basic English verbal and written communication skills are required

Strong collaboration abilities in a remote, cross-functional team

Ownership mindset - â€œyou build it, you run itâ€

Problem-solving skills with attention to detail

Quick learner in a fast-paced environment

postTitle: Strategic Enterprise Sales Director at Fingerprint
jobTitle: Strategic Enterprise Sales Director at Fingerprint
descContent:
**Fingerprint** empowers developers to stop online fraud at the source.

We work on turning radical new ideas in the fraud detection space into
reality. Our products are developer-focused and our clients range from solo
developers to publicly traded companies. **We are a globally dispersed, 100%
remote company** with a strong open-source focus. Our flagship open-source
project is [FingerprintJS](https://github.com/fingerprintjs/fingerprintjs)
(20K stars on GitHub).

[We have raised $77M
](https://www.crunchbase.com/organization/fingerprintjs)and are backed by
Craft Ventures (previously invested in [Tesla,
](https://www.tesla.com/)[Facebook, ](https://facebook.com/)[Airbnb
](https://www.airbnb.com/)), Nexus Venture Partners (previously invested in
[Postman](https://www.postman.com/), [Apollo.io,](https://www.apollo.io/)
[MinIO](https://min.io/), Druva) and Uncorrelated Ventures (previously
invested in [Redis, ](https://redis.io/)[Rollbar ](https://rollbar.com/)&[
Gradle](https://gradle.org/)).

_We have noticed a rise in recruiting impersonations across the industry,
where scammers attempt to access candidates' personal and financial
information through fake interviews and offers. All Fingerprint recruiting
email communications will always come from the @fingerprint.com domain. Any
outreach claiming to be from Fingerprint via other sources should be ignored._

#### **About the Role**

We are seeking a**Strategic Enterprise Sales Director** to lead high-value,
multi-million-dollar deals with global enterprise companies. This role is
ideal for a consultative sales leader with a **deep understanding of complex
enterprise sales, strategic account planning, and MEDDICC methodology**. You
will be responsible for developing and executing long-term account strategies
that drive revenue growth and deepen customer relationships.

#### **Key Responsibilities**

  * Comfortable managing a**book of business** , focusing on high-value enterprise accounts.
  * Skilled in implementing account planning strategies and running regular deal reviews to drive engagement across large enterprise accounts, 
  * Familiar with supporting the teamâ€™s pipeline generation efforts including running regular team PG days, managing outbound cadences, supporting marketing-driven ABM programs.
  * Uses detailed data and reporting to continuously review the health and success of their business including pipeline metrics, opportunity aging reports, deal qualification criteria, 
  * Understands how to manage a quarterly forecast and hold the team accountable to forecast accuracy and pipeline coverage ratios. 
  * Lead **complex deal negotiations** involving multiple stakeholders, procurement, and legal teams.
  * Use **MEDDPICC** to **de-risk deals** , improve win rates, and drive accurate forecasting.
  * Build strong executive relationships, acting as a **trusted advisor** to enterprise clients.
  * Collaborate cross-functionally with **Product, Customer Success, and Marketing** to drive adoption and retention.
  * Present **business cases and ROI models** to justify investment in our solutions.
  * Develop deep industry expertise to **anticipate market trends and customer needs**.
  * Drive **thought leadership** by participating in key industry events and conferences.

#### **Qualifications**

  * **7-10+ years** of enterprise sales experience, with a **strong focus on strategic selling, including value selling methodologies**.
  * Demonstrated success in closing **multi-million-dollar, multi-year SaaS contracts**.
  * Expert in **or MEDDPICC** , with a proven ability to **manage risk in complex deals**.
  * Strong **executive presence and ability to engage C-level decision-makers**.
  * Experience managing **global accounts and large buying groups**.
  * Exceptional **strategic thinking, problem-solving, and negotiation skills**.
  * Comfortable working with **cross-functional teams** to drive enterprise adoption.
  * Background in **AI, cybersecurity, identity, analytics, or infrastructure SaaS** is highly preferred.

  
_The base salary range for this role is $200,000 - $210,000 + Variable. For
cash compensation, we set standard ranges for all US based roles based on
function, level and geographic location, benchmarked against similar stage
growth companies. In order to be compliant with local legislation, as well as
to provide greater transparency to candidates, we share salary ranges on all
job postings regardless of desired hiring location. Final offer amounts are
determined by multiple factors including geographic location as well as
candidate experience and expertise, and may vary from the amounts listed
above._

_We have noticed a rise in recruiting impersonations across the industry,
where scammers attempt to access candidates' personal and financial
information through fake interviews and offers. All Fingerprint recruiting
email communications will always come from the @fingerprint.com domain. Any
outreach claiming to be from Fingerprint via other sources should be ignored._

Offers vary depending on, but not limited to, relevant experience, education,
certifications/licenses, skills, training, and market conditions.

Due to regulatory and security reasons, thereâ€™s a small number of countries
where we cannot have Fingerprint teammates based. **Additionally, because
Fingerprint is an all-remote company and people can join our workforce from
almost any country, we do not sponsor visas. Fingerprint teammates need to be
authorized to work from their home location**.

We are dedicated to creating an inclusive work environment for everyone. We
embrace and celebrate the unique experiences, perspectives and cultural
backgrounds that each employee brings to our workplace. Fingerprint strives to
foster an environment where our employees feel respected, valued and
empowered, and our team members are at the forefront in helping us promote and
sustain an inclusive workplace. We highly encourage people from
underrepresented groups in tech to apply.

If you are applying as a resident of California, please read our CCPA notice
[here](https://dev.fingerprint.com/docs/dpa-ccpa)

If you are applying as a resident of the EU, please read our GDPR notice
[here](https://dev.fingerprint.com/docs/dpa-gdpr)

postTitle: Senior Full-Stack Software Engineer, Design Systems at Circle
jobTitle: Senior Full-Stack Software Engineer, Design Systems at Circle
descContent:
### About Us

Circle is building the worldâ€™s leading all-in-one platform for online
communities. We make it possible for creators, coaches, educators, and
businesses to bring together their audience with engaging discussions, live
streams, events, chat, courses, and payments â€” all in one place, all under
their own brand.

Weâ€™re proud to be a fully remote company of around 200 (and growing!) team
members from 30+ countries around the world. We seek exceptional individuals
around the world, set them up to do the best work of their lives, and in turn,
create a meaningful impact in their own lives. We don't track hours, but we do
manage for high expectations very closely. We collaborate across time zones,
are highly async, and like to document a lot.

Twice a year, we bring the whole company together in beautiful places around
the world for our company offsites. So far, weâ€™ve hosted offsites in Turkey,
Portugal, Mexico, Thailand, Colombia, Italy, Ireland, and more, with still
more to come!

Check out our [Careers](https://careers.circle.so/) page for more about
working at Circle.

About the role

We're looking for a **Full-Stack Engineer (Internal Tooling)** to join our
Design Systems team as we aim to make Circle the top choice for creator/brand-
led communities.

In this role, you'll build and maintain internal applications and automation
tools that streamline our operations and improve team efficiency. You'll work
across the full stack, creating user-friendly interfaces, designing APIs,
integrating with third-party services, and building systems that help our
design team work smarter. You'll participate in all stages of the development
lifecycle, from understanding workflow problems to deploying production
solutions. As a full-stack engineer, you'll identify process bottlenecks,
build custom tools to solve them, integrate multiple services (Slack, Notion,
Figma, etc.), and create dashboards that provide visibility into design
operations. This role requires strong technical versatility, comfort working
across frontend and backend, and an understanding of how to build practical
tools that solve real workflow challenges.

What youâ€™ll be doing

  * Build full-stack internal applications using modern web technologies (Next.js, React, Node.js, databases)
  * Create tools that integrate multiple services and APIs (Slack, Notion, Figma, etc.) to streamline workflows
  * Design and implement databases and APIs to support internal tooling needs
  * Work with LLMs and AI APIs to automate classification, analysis, and reporting tasks
  * Develop dashboards and interfaces that provide visibility into design team operations
  * Identify workflow inefficiencies and build custom solutions to address them
  * Integrate with our Ruby on Rails backend and existing systems where needed
  * Work closely with design leadership to understand operational needs and iterate on solutions
  * Deploy and maintain internal tools, ensuring reliability and usability
  * Improve the quality of our internal tooling codebase and establish best practices
What youâ€™ll need to be successful

    * Proficiency in English at CEFR C2 / ILR Level 5 (spoken, written, reading)
    * Strong alignment with [Circle's values](https://circle.so/careers)
    * 5+ years of experience as a Full-Stack Engineer building web applications
    * Strong proficiency in modern JavaScript/TypeScript, React, and Next.js (or similar frameworks)
    * Experience with backend development: API design, databases (SQL/NoSQL), server-side logic
    * Comfortable working with third-party APIs and integrating multiple services
    * Experience building internal tools, admin dashboards, or workflow automation systems
    * Strong judgment about when to build custom solutions vs. use existing tools
    * Pragmatic approach to technical decisions - balancing speed with quality for internal tooling
    * A desire to work in an environment which values speed of iteration and individual autonomy, while also embracing personal accountability and the ability to collaborate effectively as part of a dynamic team
    * Motivation to understand team workflows, identify pain points, and deliver practical solutions
    * Comfortable in a fast-paced environment with a certain level of ambiguity
    * Adaptable with the ability to change direction quickly if necessary
    * Familiar with agile software development principles
    * Experience working on a fully distributed remote team

### Bonus points

      * Experience with AI/LLM APIs (OpenAI, Anthropic, etc.) for automation and classification
      * Previous experience building tools for design teams or creative workflows
      * Experience with workflow automation platforms (Zapier, Make, n8n)
      * Experience integrating with design tools (Figma API, etc.)
      * Experience working with a Ruby on Rails backend
      * Background in design operations, product operations, or similar operational roles
      * Experience at a fast-growing start-up
      * A track record of identifying process improvements and building tools to address them
      * Experience with data visualization and analytics dashboards

### $130,000 - $140,000 USD per year

_The cash compensation range shown is a starting point. In addition to equity,
benefits and perks, your cash compensation is subject to an annual review and
increase on a once per year basis._

### The fun stuff

      * Fully remote: work from anywhere in the world!
      * Autonomy and trust to do your job: we care about outcomes over everything else.
      * Paid time away: all employees are given 35 days of PTO annually. We also offer a paid sabbatical after 5 years.
      * Generous U.S. benchmarked compensation and startup equity no matter where you are in the world.*
      * Awesome medical coverage with 100% coverage for you and your family, or medical reimbursement options where applicable!*
      * Parental leave for parents expanding their family, or just starting one.
      * Home office stipend to help you get up and running.
      * Learning & development stipend to help you level up your professional skills.
      * Annual bonus potential for roles that don't already receive variable income or commission.
      * Company retreats: Twice a year, the Circle team gets together for a fully paid company retreat in incredible places around the world! Weâ€™ve had past retreats in Colombia, Portugal, and Mexico, with more planned on the horizon.
      * Check out our [Careers](https://careers.circle.so/) page for more.

*_Your role, location and unique circumstance may affect this._

### Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

As a fully-remote international company, diversity is baked into our DNA.
Hereâ€™s how our CEO, Sid Yadav, frames our hiring mission: â€œletâ€™s find talent
in underserved and under-represented corners of the world, set them up to do
the best work of their lives, and in turn, change their life.â€ To achieve this
hiring mission, we offer competitive U.S. benchmarked compensation no matter
where someoneâ€™s located in the world, and we proactively seek candidates who
expand representation of backgrounds, cultures and lived experiences in our
teams.

### Equal Employment Opportunity

Circle is an equal opportunity employer and as such, we do not discriminate on
the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity,
national origin, age, disability, or any other characteristic protected by
applicable laws. If you require any accommodations during the recruitment
process, please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

### How We Use Candidate Data

At Circle, we are committed to protecting your personal information. As a job
applicant, the personal data you provide to us is collected and processed in
accordance with the **General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR)** in the EU
and the **California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA)**. This notice outlines the
types of personal information we collect, the purpose for collecting it, and
your rights.

**Information We Collect:** We collect the following categories of personal
information from job applicants:

      * Contact information (such as name, email address, phone number)
      * Employment history and qualifications
      * Education history
      * References and any other information you choose to share with us during the application process

**Purpose of Collection:** We collect this information for the following
purposes:

      * To assess your qualifications and suitability for the position
      * To communicate with you during the recruitment process
      * To comply with legal and regulatory obligations

**Your Rights Under GDPR and CCPA:** You have the following rights regarding
your personal information:

      * The right to request access to the personal information we hold about you.
      * The right to request the deletion of your personal information, subject to certain legal exceptions.
      * The right to opt out of the sale of your personal information (Note: We do not sell personal information).

For more information about how we handle your personal data or to exercise
your rights, please refer to our full [Privacy
Policy](https://circle.so/privacy).

By submitting your application, you acknowledge that you have read and
understood this privacy notice.

### About Clerk

Clerk is on a mission to solve user management **once and for all.** We are a
globally distributed team dedicated to providing best-in-class developer
experience, with obsessive attention to every detail. Today, we provide
developers with full-stack React components and hooks like
[](https://clerk.dev/components/sign-up),
[](https://clerk.dev/components/sign-in),
[](https://clerk.dev/components/user-profile),
[useUser](https://clerk.com/docs/references/react/use-user), and
[useOrganization](https://clerk.com/docs/references/react/use-organization).
These APIs allow developers to build hard-to-get-right user and organization
management flows. We believe that [a component is worth a thousand
APIs](https://youtube.com/watch?v=enUuBY3HXh4).

Our Dashboard is a primary tool for configuring our components, as well as a
centralized place for managing your appâ€™s users.

### What you will do

Weâ€™re a small but growing team, with big ambitions. This means youâ€™ll have
responsibility far beyond closing out pre-sliced tickets. Weâ€™re looking for
people that are comfortable working across the stack to solve **product**
problems for real users. While weâ€™re hiring for a role that is focused on our
Dashboard product, youâ€™ll come to find that our Dashboard is a crucial way for
Clerk to dogfood our own product; and therefore is also critical for
generating product feedback and driving the direction of Clerk as a business.

We will expect you to:

  * **Collaborate with customers and teammates** \- be part of a world-class product delivery team that cares deeply about customer needs and the value of constant iteration. Weâ€™re fully remote, which means youâ€™ll need to practice good communication habits to keep things moving.

  * **Care about frontend architecture** \- youâ€™ll work hand-in-glove with multiple teams doing feature development. Youâ€™ll need to help us maintain the architecture that they are building on

  * **Execute** _-_ Clerk values engineers who execute. That means approaching work iteratively and reducing the time between feedback cycles.

  * **Thrive in a dynamic environment** _-_ Clerk is not well suited for engineers who expect every task to be a series of predefined steps. We believe the best approach is to -work- through our customerâ€™s problems in the trenches and not merely -think- through them from the sidelines.

  * **Go deep** \- We want Clerk to be the easiest way for app builderâ€™s to release and operate their businesses. To do this, we need to build the best DX on the market. This means developing deep empathy for app builderâ€™s and knowing the full depth of our customerâ€™s pain points.

  * **Embrace a**[**culture of craft**](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=z4hP80tzBL4) by focusing on engineering quality. We want our product to be best-in-class, and so we need our team to write maintainable, performant, and well-structured code.

### Who you are

Youâ€™re excited by the challenges that come with owning the â€œback of the
frontendâ€ for the Clerk Dashboard. You should be excited by the technical
challenges and architectural patterns that enable best-in-class Web
Applications.

  * Youâ€™re a Typescript/Javascript expert and opinionated around what makes a high-quality Developer Experience.

  * You write clean, idiomatic code and know your way around the modern frontend stacks.

  * Youâ€™re comfortable establishing high quality patterns that other developers adhere to and you fight to maintain those high standards as the product grows in maturity.

  * Youâ€™re passionate about Web App performance (think _Web Vitals_ but also human-centered performance topics like optimistic UI)

  * You understand what it takes to build a SaaS product.

  * You set a high bar for code quality, system design, and performance â€” and youâ€™re not afraid to fight for it.

  * You believe in solving real customer problems, even if it means making tradeoffs behind the scenes.

  * You love working on products you use yourself â€” because you know thatâ€™s how magic happens.

### Benefits

  * **Competitive Salary** â€“ We want you to know that we value the skills and experience you bring to the table. We go out of our way to make sure that you feel fairly compensated.

  * **Equity Ownership** â€“ At Clerk, we believe in shared success. That's why we offer a stock option plan so that everyone can benefit from the growth and prosperity of the company.

  * **Work Gear** \- Set up your ideal home office with the gear of your choice. At Clerk, we want to ensure that you have everything you need to perform at your best.

  * **Flexible Vacation Policy** â€“ We believe in work-life balance and trust you to take the time you need. Although we recommend 25 days per year, our vacation policy is unlimited. This is in addition to observing national holidays specific to your country of residence.

  * **Diverse and Inclusive Team** â€“ Join our exceptional, diverse, and globally distributed team at Clerk. We are committed to fostering an inclusive environment where everyone can contribute their best in building impactful products and tools for the modern web.

postTitle: Senior Product Marketing Manager at Chili Piper
jobTitle: Senior Product Marketing Manager at Chili Piper
descContent:
### **About Chili Piper**

Chili Piper is a B2B SaaS startup. Our product helps clients turn inbound
leads into qualified meetings instantly, helping revenue teams connect to
buyers faster. We are a fully remote global team dedicated to solving
interesting problems, helping others, and having fun.

Weâ€™re growing fast and we're ready to take over the world (in the most civil
and appropriate way possible, of course).

_*****CURRENTLY HIRING IN GMT-3 TO GMT+3 ONLY*****_

###  **Job description**

Weâ€™re looking for a Product Marketing Manager who can bring clarity,
alignment, and focus across Product, Marketing, and Sales. Someone who knows
how to turn complex features, data, and customer insights into clear,
compelling stories that help customers get the most out of our product and
attract new prospects to try it.

This role sits at the intersection of Product, Marketing, and Sales -
connecting teams around one clear story and shared goals. Youâ€™ll play a key
role in shaping how our AI-powered products ( like Chili Agents, Chat AI, and
Enrichment) are positioned, launched, and adopted in the market.

The ideal candidate combines strategic thinking, curiosity, and emotional
intelligence. You know how to connect the dots between features, customer
feedback, and business goals and turn them into simple, actionable stories
that drive revenue.

### **Role overview**

As a Product Marketing Manager at Chili Piper, youâ€™ll:

  * **Shape the story:** Define and evolve how we talk about our products across launches and throughout their lifecycle

  * **Build GTM plans** : Design and run go-to-market strategies that keep Product, Sales, and Marketing aligned

  * **Turn insights into action** : use customer feedback, win/loss data, and competitive research to refine our positioning and messaging

  * **Own launches:** Drive the full GTM process: from crafting the narrative to creating enablement assets, live webinars with top customers announcing new features, and driving adoption.

  * **Influence the roadmap** : partner with Product to bring real customer insights into what we build next.

  * **Enable sales:** work with the Sales team to make sure they have the right story, tools, and playbooks to convert leads into revenue.

  * **Drive growth** : collaborate with Marketing to boost awareness, activation, and expansion across channels.

### **What weâ€™re looking for**

  * Systems thinker **â†’** you see the full GTM picture and how Product, Sales, and Marketing connect. You know how to align teams around shared metrics, goals, and a single story.

  * Storyteller â†’ you can explain complex ideas in simple, human language. You create messaging that resonates with both customers and prospects.

  * Customer-oriented**** â†’ you deeply understand customer needs, motivations, and pain points and use those insights to shape messaging, features, and go-to-market strategies that truly help them succeed.

  * Strategic and hands-on â†’ you can zoom out to build GTM strategy, then zoom in to write the copy, build the deck, or create the enablement asset that makes it real.

  * Product-savvy â†’ you think like a product manager: understanding user needs, prioritizing impact, and turning feedback into product and positioning improvements.

  * Strong project manager â†’ you can take a messy idea and turn it into a clear plan with owners, milestones, and deadlines.

  * Bold and creative thinker: Youâ€™re not afraid to experiment, challenge the status quo, and take smart risks to find better ways of doing things

### **Experience**

  * 4+ years in B2B SaaS Product Marketing, ideally focused on GTM strategy, positioning, and product launches

  * Proven track record of launching complex products or features - from messaging and enablement to adoption and growth

  * Deep understanding of GTM motions across inbound, outbound, and the customer lifecycle - and how they connect to pipeline

  * Hands-on experience with competitive positioning, narrative design, and pricing strategy, especially in fast-moving markets

  * Exceptional communication skills - you can explain technical concepts in clear, simple English that resonates with both sales teams and customers

### **Bonus**

  * Experience working in AI, RevOps, or MarTech companies

  * Hands-on experience with Salesforce, HubSpot, or Gong - especially for insights, reporting, or enablement

  * Background in sales enablement or content strategy, creating assets that drive adoption and close rates

  * Familiarity with B2B SaaS sales cycles and how marketing supports pipeline creation

  * Prior experience with Chili Piper or similar tools for lead routing, meeting scheduling, or demand conversion

### **TL;DR**

Weâ€™re not hiring a â€œlaunch manager.â€

Weâ€™re hiring someone who can bring clarity, connect teams around one story,
and turn ideas into momentum. If you can do that, weâ€™d love to meet you!

### **Additional Information**

**Why you'll love being a part of our team:**

Our team loves Chili Piper because [weâ€™re building the company of the future.
](https://www.chilipiper.com/post/company-of-the-future)

  * Work with an immensely talented global team

  * Work in a business thatâ€™s run fairly and transparently

  * Competitive pay based on market rate wherever you live

  * We lead by example--showing industry peers and leaders how to innovate, improve, and grow--while having fun

**How we work:**

  * **Freedom and flexibility.** Weâ€™re a 100% distributed team working from around the world, and we've been fully remote since 2016.  _**Our team members can work from wherever they want**_ in the world, as long as they show up on our weekly all hands meeting on Zoom.

  * **Solve interesting problems.** The software landscape has exploded. There are dozens of solutions for each problem. We want to be different. We come up with new angles on existing problems or invent better solutions to help companies with their sales and marketing. Then we turn these ideas into beautiful, smart software.

  * **Autonomy and ownership.** Working on a distributed team means you donâ€™t have someone micromanaging you or looking over your shoulder to make sure youâ€™re getting things done. Weâ€™re a team of do-ers who take full ownership for their results.

  * **Be helpful.** Our first value as a company is help. Help our customers be successful. Help our prospects get the right information and make the right decision whether or not it includes our products. Help our team members reach their full potential.

**The perks:**

  * Unlimited vacation (and we _do_ mean it, and we _do_ take it!)

  * Generous health, dental, and vision insurance

  * Any equipment/software/tech that you need to do your job

  * Annual professional development stipend of $2,000 USD

  * Equity - all Pipers receive stock options

  * Annual company retreat for a week of bonding and adventure (previous retreat locations include Paris, Morocco, Tulum, Iceland, Ibiza, and India!)

postTitle: Senior Backend Engineer- Remote, Worldwide at Nethermind
jobTitle: Senior Backend Engineer- Remote, Worldwide at Nethermind
descContent:
**Are you the one?**

We are looking for an experienced Senior Backend Engineer to design and build
high-performance systems that power institutional-grade blockchain and DeFi
applications.

You are a builder at heart who thrives on solving complex distributed systems
challenges and transforming ideas into scalable, reliable infrastructure. You
have a deep understanding of software engineering principles and fluency in
one or more modern programming languages (e.g. Go, Python, Rust, C#, or Java).

You care deeply about writing clean, maintainable code, designing for
performance and enterprise-level security, and building systems that scale
gracefully under real-world conditions.

This is a remote-first role, working with a globally distributed team of
engineers and researchers, and in close collaboration with leading financial
institutions and blockchain ecosystem partners.

**Responsibilities** :

  * Design, develop, and maintain backend systems and APIs that are efficient, secure, and scalable.

  * Architect distributed systems that integrate blockchain data, financial logic, and external services with strong guarantees of reliability and correctness.

  * Build high-throughput data pipelines and services that interact with on-chain infrastructure and blockchain protocols like DeFi.

  * Continuously optimize systems for speed, scalability, and resilience, using data-driven insights and monitoring tools.

  * Collaborate with cross-functional teams, blockchain engineers, researchers, and product leads, to deliver institutional-grade solutions.

**Skills:**

  * 5+ years of software engineering experience, with a solid grasp of design patterns, testing strategies, and best practices.

  * Strong programming skills in at least one of: Go, Python, Rust, C#, Java, or TypeScript/Node.js.

  * Deep experience with databases, both relational (PostgreSQL, MySQL) and non-relational (MongoDB, Redis), including schema design and performance tuning.

  * Proven ability to design, scale, and maintain distributed systems from initial architecture through production operations.

  * Solid understanding of API design, system observability, and performance optimization at scale.

  * Working knowledge of containerization, CI/CD pipelines, and cloud environments (AWS, GCP, or Azure).

**Nice to have:**

  * Background in large-scale financial or blockchain systems and organizations (Hedge Funds, FinTechs, Asset Managers), with exposure to compliance, security, and data-sensitivity requirements.

  * Familiarity with on-chain/off-chain integrations, blockchain data indexing, or DeFi protocols.

  * Experience with data pipelines, AI/ML-driven systems, or event-driven architectures.

  * Contributions to open-source projects, cloud-native systems, or technical leadership in cross-functional engineering teams.

  * Understanding of cryptographic concepts or zero-knowledge technologies is a plus.

**What We Offer/ Benefits**

  * **Flexible Work Options** : Remote-first culture with the opportunity to work from anywhere.

  * **Global and Diverse Workforce:** You'll work with people from various backgrounds and cultures.

  * **Learning and Development** : You'll work on innovative, challenging projects and have access to experts and mentors to enhance your skills.

  * **Career Growth** : Access to training, mentorship, and opportunities to contribute to open-source initiatives.

  * **Global Events and Conferences:** Opportunities to attend the industry events.

  * **Collaborative and Innovative Culture:** We foster teamwork and encourage new ideas.

  * **Unlimited Time Off** : Enjoy the freedom to structure your working hours in a way that suits you best, with the flexibility to take unpaid time off whenever needed to maintain a healthy work-life balance.

**Our Commitment to Diversity**

At Nethermind, we celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an
inclusive environment for all team members. We believe a variety of
perspectives drives innovation and leads to better solutions for the
blockchain community.

**Ready to Join Us?**

If you're passionate about blockchain and eager to make an impact, weâ€™d love
to hear from you. Click **Apply for this job t** o start your journey with
Nethermind.

### **About us**

Founded in 2015 with the mission to protect the open economy, OpenZeppelin is
the world leader in securing blockchain applications and smart contracts.

Our Open-Source Contract Libraries are a public good that have facilitated the
transfer of over $35 trillion and are considered the industry standard for
smart contract development.

Our professional expertise integrates seamlessly into clientsâ€™ development
lifecycles, enabling teams to plan, code, audit, deploy, and operate projects
more quickly and securely.

**Please note:** Always refer to OpenZeppelin's official job page for the most
accurate information about our open roles, as we have seen multiple third
party job sites posting inaccurate information.

### **What you'll be doing**

  * Review smart contracts for the top decentralized applications before they get launched and present findings and vulnerabilities that the protocol can have to the client.

  * Team up with one or two auditors and review code line by line and try to hack it.

  * Working on proposals to make code easier to understand and use in the future by sharing good practices

  * Conduct open-ended research around cutting edge blockchain technologies.

  * Paid time to conduct research and contribute to OpenZeppelinâ€™s projects and knowledge

### **You have**

  * Hands-on and practical experience in one or more of the following areas: software development, cyber security, mathematics.

  * Experience with public Ethereum or other EVM-based blockchains.

  * Knowledge in the Solidity programming language.

  * Intellectual curiosity and the capability to learn complex topics

  * Above-average attention to detail skills.

  * The ability to work independently, with minimal supervision.

  * An advanced English level and great communication skills (oral and written).

  * Passion about the blockchain space and decentralization.

  * Ability to work collaboratively in a distributed team.

### **Nice to have**

  * Experience in Back-end programming using JavaScript, Python, Golang or Rust

  * Experience performing code reviews.

  * Experience in financial engineering and/or capital markets microstructure

### **Note**

If you don't meet all of the listed requirements, but think you're a good fit
for the position, please apply so we can review.

### **Logistics**

Our interview process takes place on Zoom and tends to consist of the
following stages:

  * Recruiter call (30 minutes)

  * Leadership interview (60 minutes)

  * Team member interview (60 minutes)

  * Paid work trial (code review)

  * Reference checks

Please let us know if you require any accommodations for the interview
process, and weâ€™ll do our best to provide assistance.

### **Benefits**

  * Company in-person gatherings in different locations around the world ğŸ˜
  * Fully remote work ğŸŒ
  * Flexible time off ğŸ
  * Paid parental leave ğŸ’™
  * One time work-from-home equipment stipend of up to $500 USD ğŸª‘
  * Medical insurance coverage ğŸ¥
  * Learning & Development opportunities ğŸ§ 
  * Work with a global team in a fast-growing industry ğŸš€

At **OpenZeppelin** , we are an equal opportunity employer and we value
different perspectives. We are committed to building a diverse workforce. This
includes but is not limited to gender, race, sexual orientation, religion,
national origin and other characteristics that make each one of us unique. In
this uniqueness, we find the most value. Come join us!

**About the Company**

Our client stands as the premier residential construction company in the ADU
(Accessory Dwelling Unit) market in Sacramento. Founded on the pillars of
family tradition and exceptional craftsmanship over three decades ago, the
company has successfully transformed into a cutting-edge, technology-driven
enterprise without compromising its core values of quality, innovation, and
customer satisfaction. As the #1 leader in Sacramento's ADU market, they
continue to set industry standards, driving innovation and excellence in every
project they undertake.

  * HQ Location: Sacramento, California (USA)

  * Industry: ADUs, Residential Construction, Prop-tech

  * Product or service: ADU design and construction

  * Average deal size: 200k

  * Remote Worldwide: 7 AM to 3 PM PST

Our client's **mission** is to revolutionize living spaces by delivering
exceptional ADU solutions that maximize property value and enhance the quality
of life. Our client combines traditional craftsmanship with state-of-the-art
technology to meet and exceed the evolving needs of homeowners.  
  
**The Opportunity**

As a **Remote Project Manager** , you'll be at the heart of transforming
families' lives by helping them create beautiful, functional living spaces.
You'll coordinate multiple ADU construction projects from start to finish,
serving as the vital connection between clients realizing their dreams,
skilled subcontractors, and our client's award-winning team. Join a
construction company with over 30 years of excellence, where you will help
families build equity, gain rental income, and create homes for the people
they love.

**What You'll Do**

  * Negotiate with clients and subcontractors on additional payments, change orders, and disputed issues to ensure fair outcomesâ€‹â€‹

  * Coordinate with clients and internal stakeholders through Zoom, email, and chat platforms, managing 20+ concurrent conversationsâ€‹â€‹

  * Manage project documentation, including contracts, estimates, scope of work statements, and legal case materialsâ€‹â€‹

  * Translate construction information clearly between technical teams and non-technical clientsâ€‹â€‹

  * Facilitate cross-cultural communication between English-speaking clients and Russian-speaking team membersâ€‹

  * Maintain professionalism and patience when managing challenging client situations throughout the project lifecycleâ€‹â€‹

**What You Bring**

  * 1+ years of project or operations ownership experience in Project Management, Product Management, or Operations Lead roles within B2C or B2B2C environments

  * Ability to manage multiple projects, coordinate the schedule of subcontractors, and construction managers

  * Proficiency in English (C1) + fluency in Russian, Ukrainian, or other Slavic languages

  * Understanding of budgeting, cost control, and the ability to process large amounts of information

  * Self-organized with strong time management skills and high attention to detail

  * Proficiency in using modern project management software and AI tools

  * Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, team player

  *  _Bonus:_ experience in residential construction project management

**Key Success Drivers**

  * Passionate about negotiation and problem-solving with integrity and transparencyâ€‹â€‹

  * Client-focused with meticulous attention to detail and a self-organized approach to complex projectsâ€‹â€‹

  * Results-driven with an ownership mindset, accountability, and commitment to meeting project outcomesâ€‹â€‹

  * Adaptable and comfortable working in fast-paced, cross-cultural environments with changing prioritiesâ€‹â€‹

  * Exceptional communicator with diplomatic approach, collaborative spirit, and commitment to continuous learning

**Why Join?**

  * Employment Type: full-time

  * Work Environment: 100% fully remote with set working hours, 7 am to 3 pm PST

  * Base salary: $2,000/month + unlimited bonus

  * Paid Time Off (PTO) policy: vacation, sick days, and company holidays

  * Clear career growth opportunities

  * Digital-first and paperless culture, supportive team

  * Work with a #1 leader in the ADU market in Sacramento (California), known for quality and innovation

**Interviewing Process**

  * HR screening - Lavendo

  * HR screening - Client

  * Level 1: Virtual interview with the Permit Manager and Heads of Departments (Sales & Production)

  * Level 2: Take-home test assignment

  * Reference and Background Checks: conducted after successful interviews

  * Job Offer: provided to the selected candidate

 _We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and are committed to equal
employment opportunity regardless of race, color, religion, national origin,
age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, genetic
information, veteran status, gender identity, or expression, sexual
orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal,
state or local law._

postTitle: Enterprise Account Executive (remote-only Europe) at CloudLinux
jobTitle: Enterprise Account Executive (remote-only Europe) at CloudLinux
descContent:
CloudLinux is a global remote-first company. We are driven by our principles:
do the right thing, employees first, we are remote first, and we deliver high
volume, low-cost Linux infrastructure and security products that help
companies to increase the efficiency of their operations. Every person on our
team supports each other and does what we can to ensure we all are successful.

TuxCare is a subsidiary of CloudLinux. It offers a portfolio of security
solutions for Linux and open-source software aimed at enterprise
organizations. With TuxCare, enterprises can automate live vulnerability
patching, minimize downtime, keep their applications secure and compliant, and
get support from a team that knows Linux security best â€“ covering the most
popular Linux distributions, end-of-life systems, programming languages, and
much more.  
For more information, visit our website: <https://tuxcare.com/>

We are looking for an experienced Enterprise Account Executive with a strong
background in selling Linux products. As our Account Executive, you will work
directly with the Director of Enterprise Sales and have the opportunity to
drive the growth of our Enterprise business. Your ability to work
independently and manage complex sales will be valued.

**As our TuxCare Account Executive, you will:**

  * Research, plan, and implement new target market initiatives
  * Create development plans, forecast sales targets, and growth projections
  * Move solid leads through the marketing funnel, and close business
  * Discover and build multiple Champions in multiple departments to ensure successful sales
  * Create cost justifications to meet each of departmentâ€™s needs
  * Collaborate with the Director of Enterprise Sales to ensure the company's goals and targets are met
  * Identify market opportunities through meetings, networking and other channels
  * Meet existing and potential clients and building positive relationships
  * Attend events such as exhibitions and conferences
  * Prepare sales presentations and participate in sales meetings
  * Produce reports for management
  * Research prospective accounts in target markets

**Requirements**

**To be successful, you should have:**

  * Proven experience selling Enterprise SaaS products preferably within the Linux, Cyber Security industry
  * Deep understanding of the Linux industry
  * Strong drive to build and grow business 
  * Ability to lead and mentor junior team members 

**Benefits**

**What's in it for you?**

  * A focus on professional development; 
  * Interesting and challenging projects
  * Flexible working hours
  * Paid one month vacation per year and unlimited sick leave
  * Medical insurance reimbursement
  * Co-working and gym/sports reimbursement
  * The opportunity to receive a reward for the most innovative idea that the company can patent

_By applying for this position, you consent to the processing of your personal
data as described in our Privacy Policy (_[_https://cloudlinux.com/candidate-
privacy-notice_](https://cloudlinux.com/candidate-privacy-notice) _), which
provides detailed information on how we maintain and handle your data._

WHY YOU SHOULD APPLY:

Coalition Technologies is devoted to delivering clients the highest quality
work while providing our team a fun, thriving, and innovative environment.
Along with the opportunity for tremendous career growth and rapid advancement,
CT offers:

  * The most competitive profit-sharing bonus plan in the industry, paying up to 50% of company profits to full-time employees each month!
  * A highly competitive Paid Time Off plan, promoting quality work-life balance.
  * Subsidized gym memberships to help team members feel their best.
  * Medical, dental, vision, and life insurance packages for all US-based team members.
  * International Health Insurance Reimbursement Program for all international team members, a benefit unique to Coalition.
  * Device upgrade and learning reimbursement programs.
  * Motivating career development plans with clearly defined goals and rewards.
  * Additional job-specific incentives and bonuses.  
  

Plus, 100% of our team works remotely with the support of time tracking
software. Our company culture specializes in supporting remote team members,
and weâ€™ve been doing so for more than a decade. CT welcomes your application,
wherever in the world it's coming from!

YOU SHOULD HAVE:

  * Willingness to learn, grow, and collaborate with the team and company as a whole.
  * Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  * A high level of discretion, ethics, and trustworthiness.
  * Intermediate spreadsheet skills (preferred)
  * Innovative thinking and a willingness to challenge existing methods where improvement is possible.
  * Experience in bookkeeping / financial record keeping (preferred).
  * Experience with Google Sheets or Excel, Quickbooks Online, and G-Suite (preferred).
  * The availability to work 40 hours per week from 9:00 am to 6:00 pm PST.
  * A reliable space to work remotely with a fast computer, quality internet, camera, microphone, and speakers.

YOUR DUTIES AND TASKS:

  * Answering phones and emails.
  * Completing entry-level bookkeeping, including recording expenses, organizing receipts, and completing other transaction records.
  * Resolving billing issues with clients and internal team members.
  * Providing account access, usage reports, data analysis, and other ad hoc requests for team members.
  * Supporting quality assurance checks of various internal and client facing reporting.
  * Organizing new client contracts, create invoices, and process client payments.
  * Contributing to internal database maintenance, upkeep and data entry.
  * Researching, ordering, & distributing company-wide gifts (2-3 times per year).
  * Organizing company events, competitions, and special projects throughout the year.
  * Facilitating company holiday, time off, and schedule variation calendars.

We are looking for talented and diligent candidates who excel in our skills
tests, and will consider these candidates even if past experience or
educational background criteria aren't met.

*California, New York, Washington, and Colorado: starting base pay for this position ranges between $15 - $25 per hour.

Compensation may vary based on factors such as experience, qualifications,
skills test performance, geographic location, and seniority of the position
offered. Outside of California, New York, Washington, and Colorado
compensation may fall outside the above ranges.

intelligence tools. We ingest data from across the news, web, and social media

world's most pressing challenges, including democracy, climate, and AI policy.

*Company: Labs AI

*Location:* Worldwide (Remote)

*Type:* Full-time / Part-time / Contract

*Start Date: Immediate

About Labs AI

*Labs AI* is a forward-thinking blockchain innovation lab building the next generation of decentralized ecosystems. Our mission is to merge "AI automation with crypto, blockchain, and perpetual DEX technology" â€” powering transparency, yield, and scalability in the decentralized world.

Weâ€™re building a global movement of innovators, traders, and creators â€” and
weâ€™re looking for a confident, well-spoken "Spokesperson & Community Host" to
become the voice and face of our brand.

**  
**

###  

### # **Role Overview**

As our "Spokesperson & Community Host", youâ€™ll represent *Labs AI* in online
meetings, Twitter Spaces, AMAs, and live community events. Youâ€™ll communicate
our mission, vision, and ecosystem updates directly to the public â€” building
trust, engagement, and excitement around our perpetual DEX and blockchain
products.

###  

### # **Key Responsibilities**

 **  
**

* Host *live online sessions* (Zoom / Google Meet / Twitter Spaces) with global audiences.

* Conduct and moderate *AMAs*, product briefings, and community updates.

* Present *Labs AIâ€™s ecosystem*, token utilities, and DeFi innovations in an easy-to-understand, engaging manner.

* Collaborate with the marketing and product teams to develop *talking points, scripts, and visuals* for community outreach.

* Represent the company in **public virtual panels, podcasts, and community partnerships**.

* Gather community feedback, answer live questions, and provide insights to the internal team.

* Build enthusiasm, trust, and long-term relationships with the crypto community.

### # **Required Skills & Experience**

 **  
**

* Strong communication and on-camera presence.

* Proven experience hosting webinars, AMAs, or community events (Twitter Spaces, Discord, YouTube, or Zoom).

* Clear understanding of **crypto, blockchain, DeFi, and perpetual DEX** concepts.

* Ability to simplify technical ideas into accessible language for a general audience.

* Fluent in English; additional languages are a plus.

* Confident, positive personality with a professional and inspiring delivery style.

* Experience working remotely and independently across multiple time zones.

### # **Preferred Qualifications**

 **  
**

* 1+ years in community management, PR, or brand representation roles.

* Experience in Web3, crypto exchanges, or decentralized platforms.

* Familiarity with live streaming tools (OBS, StreamYard, etc.).

* Previous appearances in AMAs, Twitter Spaces, or blockchain events.

### # **What We Offer**

 **  
**

* 100% remote work â€” flexible hours.

* Opportunity to **become the public voice of a fast-growing blockchain brand**.

* Competitive pay (base + bonuses based on performance and engagement).

* Early access to our ecosystem, token benefits, and community rewards.

  * A chance to grow your personal brand in the **Web3 and DeFi space**.

### # **Equal Opportunity**

 **  
**

**Labs AI** is an equal-opportunity organization. We welcome applicants from
all backgrounds, nationalities, and experience levels, united by one passion â€”
building the decentralized future.

**  
  
  
  
**  

Please mention the word**BLOSSOM** when applying to show you read the job post
completely (#RNTguMTc3LjUyLjg4). This is a feature to avoid fake spam
applicants. Companies can search these words to find applicants that read this
and instantly see they're human.  
  

## Salary and compensation

  
$30,000 â€” $50,000/year

postTitle: Sr. Customer Love Engineer - EMEA at Chili Piper
jobTitle: Sr. Customer Love Engineer - EMEA at Chili Piper
descContent:
### **About Chili Piper**

Chili Piper is a B2B SaaS startup. Our product helps clients turn inbound
leads into qualified meetings instantly, helping revenue teams connect to
buyers faster. We are a fully remote global team dedicated to solving
interesting problems, helping others, and having fun.

Weâ€™re growing fast and we're ready to take over the world (in the most civil
and appropriate way possible, of course).

### **Job Description**

The goal of the Department of Customer Love is to be the voice of our
customers and drive change (and we're proud to say we do[ a pretty dang good
job at it, too](https://www.chilipiper.com/post/customer-love)). Youâ€™ll be the
closest to the customer and interacting with them daily, so weâ€™re leaning on
you to identify and advocate for how we can keep improving the customer
experience. Currently, we are looking to add a Senior Customer Love Engineer
within the EMEA region.

_**What You'll Do**_

  * Learn how Chili Piper works and why our customers use it

  * Shadow colleagues, learn best practices for what makes CP Customers successful

  * Resolve customer questions in chat, email, and over zoom

  * Master your knowledge of the Chili Piper product and have a deep understanding of how our customers use Chili Piper to achieve their goals

  * Juggle customer conversations while maintaining five-star customer service standards

  * Guide new customers through their first steps with Chili Piper via short onboarding calls

  * Ensure timely and thoughtful follow-up through our support channels to help them see early value and stick with the product

  * Work closely with customers and our product team to help ship changes that reduce the number of product-related questions

  * Own swift resolution of technical issues on behalf of our customers by partnering with the product team. This includes identifying, escalating, and suggesting solutions in order to drive a successful outcome

  * Consistently set, deliver on, and exceed customer-centric objectives with meaningful outcomes 

  * Analyze logs to find specific incident events

  * Replicate behaviors or bugs

  * Keep an eye on critical issues and alert the engineering team

 _**Who You Are**_

  * Personable, kind, and you love helping customers

  * Curious, motivated, and you love problem solving

  * A team player. You are very comfortable asking for help and always ready to help others

  * A quick learner of complex concepts

### **Qualifications**

 _**What We're Looking For**_

  * Experience with CSS/HTML/Javascript & REST APIâ€™s

  * Experience with Support ticketing software (Zendesk, Helpscout, Intercom, etcâ€¦.)

  * Experience with logs (AWS, Google Cloud, Graylog)

  * General knowledge about APIs and endpoints

  * Experience with JIRA

  * 3+ years in software (SaaS) customer support

  * Experience guiding new customers through onboarding or implementation processes

  * Proven ability to communicate complex workflows in simple, actionable steps

  * Salesforce Admin Certified a plus

  * Marketo, Hubspot, Pardot, or Eloqua certified a plus

  * **Must be based within EMEA**

### **Additional Information**

**Why you'll love being a part of our team:**

Our team loves Chili Piper because [weâ€™re building the company of the future.
](https://www.chilipiper.com/post/company-of-the-future)

  * Work with an immensely talented global team

  * Work in a business thatâ€™s run fairly and transparently

  * Competitive pay based on market rate wherever you live

  * We lead by example--showing industry peers and leaders how to innovate, improve, and grow--while having fun

**How we work:**

  * **Freedom and flexibility.** Weâ€™re a 100% distributed team working from around the world, and we've been fully remote since 2016.  _**Our team members can work from wherever they want**_ in the world, as long as they show up on our weekly all hands meeting on Zoom.

  * **Solve interesting problems.** The software landscape has exploded. There are dozens of solutions for each problem. We want to be different. We come up with new angles on existing problems or invent better solutions to help companies with their sales and marketing. Then we turn these ideas into beautiful, smart software.

  * **Autonomy and ownership.** Working on a distributed team means you donâ€™t have someone micromanaging you or looking over your shoulder to make sure youâ€™re getting things done. Weâ€™re a team of do-ers who take full ownership for their results.

  * **Be helpful.** Our first value as a company is help. Help our customers be successful. Help our prospects get the right information and make the right decision whether or not it includes our products. Help our team members reach their full potential.

**The perks:**

  * Unlimited vacation (and we _do_ mean it, and we _do_ take it!)

  * Generous health, dental, and vision insurance

  * Any equipment/software/tech that you need to do your job

  * Annual professional development stipend of $2,000 USD

  * Equity - all Pipers receive stock options

  * Annual company retreat for a week of bonding and adventure (previous retreat locations include Paris, Morocco, Tulum, Iceland, Ibiza, and India!)

**About us:**

[Ignite Visibility](https://ignitevisibility.com/) is an award-winning,
technology-enabled digital marketing agency, recognized for our cutting-edge
approach to product creation and performance marketing.

Weâ€™re a powerhouse of innovation, driven by a team of strategists, creators,
and engineers who work remotely and thrive in a diverse, fast-paced
environment. Our mission is simple: deliver best-in-class results through bold
thinking and strategic digital solutions that make a real impact.

Recently, **Ignite Visibility** has expanded through the strategic acquisition
of **Outliant** , integrating their exceptional product and website
development expertise into our collective.

While you may still see **Outliant** email addresses from hiring managers,
please note that all positions are now part of Ignite Visibility. We continue
to live by a culture that inspires excellence, values ingenuity, and empowers
every team member to push boundaries and deliver seamless digital experiences.

Join Ignite Visibility, where visionary ideas lead to exceptional growth and
impactful results!

**About the role:**

Weâ€™re seeking a full-time **Web Designer (Marketing-Focused)** to join our
team and help craft seamless and engaging user experiences across our
projects.

In this role, youâ€™ll be responsible for designing fully responsive visuals
from concept to completion, ensuring exceptional user experiences. Your
primary focus will include creating marketing landing pages, managing related
advertisements, and executing branding initiatives.

Weâ€™re looking for a creative professional with strong skills in developing
impactful marketing materials while maintaining brand consistency across
multiple channels.

**For candidates outside the EST time zone, this position requires some
overlap with EST working hours.**

**Seniority Level** : Senior Level

**Responsibilities:**

**Visual Design:**

  * **Creating Visual Content:** Designing marketing materials such as landing pages, social media graphics, email templates, and advertisements that align with the brandâ€™s visual identity and marketing goals.

  * **Brand Consistency:** Ensuring all designs maintain consistency with the brandâ€™s guidelines and messaging across different platforms and channels.

  * **Campaign Design:** Developing visuals for marketing campaigns, including banners, promotional materials, and other assets to support marketing strategies and goals.

**Market Research and Analysis:**

  * Conduct thorough user research to understand user needs, behaviors, and preferences.

  * Analyze industry trends and competitor designs to create innovative and effective marketing materials.

**Information Architecture:**

  * Develop information architecture and user flows to create intuitive and effective user experiences.

  * Organize and structure content for optimal user engagement and navigation.

**Usability Testing:**

  * Plan and conduct usability testing sessions to gather feedback on designs and identify areas for improvement.

  * Iterate designs based on user testing results and feedback.

**Accessibility and Inclusivity:**

  * Ensure designs are accessible to users with diverse abilities and needs.

  * Stay updated on accessibility standards and integrate them into the design process.

**User Interface Design:**

  * Design visually appealing and user-friendly interfaces that align with brand guidelines.

  * Create low-fidelity and high-fidelity wireframes to visualize and communicate design concepts.

  * Develop interactive prototypes to test and iterate on design solutions.

**Organization & Documentation:**

  * Produce detailed visual and interaction assets to streamline the development team's implementation of designs. This includes creating comprehensive style guides, defining precise variables, and providing other essential documentation for seamless implementation. Create design systems to ensure design consistency across all platforms, devices, and user touchpoints.

  * Handoff Delivery: Prepare and deliver comprehensive design handoffs to engineering teams, including detailed specifications and design systems.

  * Industry Awareness: Stay up-to-date with industry design trends and technologies to create innovative and effective products.

**Collaboration:**

  * Work closely with cross-functional teams, including developers, product managers, and other stakeholders.

  * Drive collaborative client interactions to elevate designs beyond expectations.

  * Receiving and incorporating feedback from stakeholders to refine and improve designs.

**Ownership:**

  * Managing multiple design projects simultaneously, adhering to deadlines, and ensuring high-quality deliverables.

  * Strategic thinking to align design efforts with overall business goals.

  * Decision-making skills to resolve design conflicts and make informed choices.

**Requirements:**

  * **Minimum of 5 years of professional** design experience, preferably in a B2B environment, including agency, tech, or freelance work. Startup agency experience is a big plus.

  * **Graphic Design Skills:** Expertise in creating compelling visual content with strong understanding of design principles, typography, and color theory. Proficient in Adobe Creative Suite and other design tools for producing high-quality graphics.

  * **UI Skills:** Excel in creating scalable UI designs for desktop and mobile using Figma and Adobe Suite. 

  * **Web Mastery:** Showcase advanced proficiency in web design, with a deep understanding of user interfaces, user experience principles, and the ability to create visually compelling and user-friendly websites.

  * **Organization** : Skilled in systemic design for team-wide use, covering components, typography, colors, grids, and margins.

  * **Accountable** : Take ownership, solve problems independently, and commit to project success.

  * **Communication** : Effective in team and client communication, presenting research and design concepts.

  * Strong **portfolio** that demonstrates a range of work in both print and digital.

  * Experience with **Figma** and **Adobe Illustrator** , **Photoshop** is a plus!

  * Excellent communication skills.

  * Self-starter with a strong sense of ownership and ability to work autonomously.

  * Ability to work independently and in a team environment.

**Whatâ€™s in it for you?**

As a full-time member of our team, youâ€™ll enjoy:

  * Unlimited PTO

  * Non-working holidays per country of residence

  * Pro-rated 13th-month bonus in select regions

  * Salary increases and performance-based bonuses

  * Referral bonuses

  * Monthly internet stipend

  * Fun and casual work environment

  * Employee engagement activities and virtual gatherings

  * We are a diverse, global team! ğŸŒ

**Important Notice**

To ensure the legitimacy of job opportunities, we strongly recommend that you
solely rely on positions posted here on our official website:
[**outliant.com/careers**](http://outliant.com/careers).

All our current job openings require video interviews conducted in either or
both synchronous (via Google Meet) and asynchronous (via HireFlix) formats.
Kindly refrain from accepting offers that appear suspicious. For any inquiries
or concerns, feel free to reach out to us via email at
[**recruitment@outliant.com**](mailto:recruitment@outliant.com).

Please be assured that we are fully committed to maintaining integrity in our
hiring process.

**COMPANY**

At [0x](https://0x.org/), our mission is to "Create a Tokenized World Where
All Forms of Value Can Flow Freely". We deliver this to web3 builders with a
delightfully simple suite of developer APIs that provide faster trading,
better prices, and superior user experience.

Founded in 2017, weâ€™ve processed over 78M+ transactions and $140B+ in trading
volume from users trading on Matcha, Coinbase Wallet, Robinhood Wallet,
Phantom, Rainbow, DefiLlama, MetaMask, Zerion, Zapper, and many more. Our
investors include Greylock Partners, Pantera Capital, and Jump Crypto.

When you join 0x, youâ€™ll become part of a veteran team of crypto builders who
know the importance of code quality, team cohesion, and a culture of learning.

**The Role**  
  
Join our **Liquidity Engineering** team, whose mission is to maximize our
pricing coverage and competitiveness to maintain our position as the best DEX
aggregation engine on the planet on 20+ chains across both EVM and SVM.

We work at the frontier of liquidity sourcing, AMM modeling, and route
optimization, ensuring our infrastructure is robust, fast, and always ahead of
the competition. Youâ€™ll help shape the future of how tokenized value flows in
DeFi: without interruptions, with high accuracy, and across the most relevant
chains and markets.  

### Responsibilities - What youâ€™ll do

  * **Find and integrate AMMs** into our existing routers for both SVM and EVM environments to maximize price competitiveness, token coverage and execution quality of our trading APIs

  * **Build tools** to automatically analyze DEX liquidity across 20+ chains. Identify and act on price improvement opportunities using data-driven insights and protocol knowledge

  * **Balance speed and pricing** to achieve the right outcomes for the business; maximize win rates within meta-aggregators, wallets, and the broader competitive landscape

  * **Continuously monitor, troubleshoot, and improve** our liquidity integrations to maintain top-tier performance

  * **Stay ahead of trends** in DEX design, evaluating and onboarding high-value opportunities

  * **Accurately predict and prioritize** which new DEXes will have the greatest impact on price competitiveness

### Requirements - Who you are

  * 5+ years of professional software engineering experience, including 2+ years in DeFi

  * In-depth knowledge of design and mechanics of leading AMMs (constant product, concentrated liquidity, stable-swap, orderbook, etc.)

  * Comfortable coding in Rust

  * Basic working knowledge of Solidity

  * Proven ability to design systems with input from multiple stakeholders, balancing technical, product, and operational trade-offs

  * Experience modifying existing production codebases and shipping those changes without impact to system uptime

  * Experience implementing systems with high performance/latency demands

  * Self-driven and effective in a fully remote environment. A successful candidate will be able to communicate clearly and work independently while staying closely aligned with the team.

  * Knowledge and passion for decentralized finance and the [0x mission](https://0x.org/post/the-0x-mission-and-values#:~:text=greater%20financial%20sovereignty.-,Our%20mission,the%20same%20way%20that%20the%20internet%20has%20democratized%20access%20to%20information.,-Workshop%20Cafe%20in)

  * Exhibit our [core values](https://0x.org/post/the-0x-mission-and-values#:~:text=Our%20core%20values,through%20these%20battles.): do the right thing, consistently ship, and focus on long-term impact

  * Willingness to travel globally for two annual in-person team meetups - all travel expenses covered

### Preferred

  * Experience integrating onchain with major DEX protocols and aggregators (e.g., Uniswap, Curve, Balancer)

  * Familiarity with both EVM and SVM ecosystems, including chain-specific nuances: transaction lifecycle, performance optimizations and MEV dynamics

  * Experience building tools or frameworks for liquidity analysis and price competitiveness benchmarking

  * Bonus points if you're able to explain a new, complex, or unusual AMM design to us in plain English

**BENEFITS**

  * Comprehensive insurance (medical/dental/vision/life/disability) for U.S.-based employees â€” 100% of base plan covered for you and dependents

  * 401k and FSA for U.S.-based employees

  * Monthly mobile phone bill, wellness, and pre-tax transportation expense

  * Covered mental health benefits (included professional therapy sessions)

  * A supportive remote environment

  * Lunch reimbursement for all employees across the globe!

  * Stipend for your ideal remote / WFH set-up: headphones, and any other work gear you may need

  * 12-week paid parental leave

  * Great office conveniently located in the SF Financial District for those in the region!

  * Flexible vacation: Take time when you need it (and we really mean it!)

0x and its associated entities are dedicated to fostering diversity,
inclusion, and belonging in its teams and workforce, and are proud to be equal
opportunity employers. 0x does not make employment or hiring decisions on the
basis of race, color, creed, religion, sex (including those who are pregnant
or have given birth), sexual orientation, gender, gender expression or
identity, age, disability, medical condition, genetic information, military or
veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, citizenship, national origin,
immigration or citizenship status, political affiliation, or any other basis
that is protected by applicable local, state, or federal laws. This includes
not making such decisions based on the status itself, as well as any
associations, perceptions, and assumptions made regarding these statuses. 0x
will also consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records in
a way that is consistent with San Franciscoâ€™s Fair Chance Ordinance and
similar local laws. Our commitment to equal employment opportunity extends to
ensuring that all applicants and employees can perform to their fullest
potential, including through obtaining reasonable accommodations when
necessary.
